description:
I absolutely agree with so many of the other reviews -- this is definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in town (and yes, I know there are many!). 

Luckily, I live super close by and Siam Lotus is my go-to for Pad Kee Mao!
author: Meesh L.

description:
As far as decent thai food goes, Siam Lotus does its job. You can eat in or get take out. I frankly need to expand my taste buds and not keep ordering pad see ew, pad kee mow, or pad thai. They got some decent fried rices too though I guess that doesn't help my case much. They have more on the menu you can try! Really!

As for the food itself, it's good though not particularly overpowering in flavor though that can be a good thing for some. Adjust the spice level as you will, a medium isn't all too bad and ought to be a good level for most people. 

All in all, this is an unassuming restaurant that serves decent thai food for the price you pay.
author: Derek T.

description:
Best Thai restaurant in town! Test the coconut pad Thai and coconut soup!!

The tenant is also always super nice and welcoming!
author: Anne-Sophie F.

description: Visiting town. Ordered Drunken Asparagus Noodles, Spring rolls, jasmine tea. Delicious, big portions, reasonable prices, made fresh. They had traditional dishes and obvious spin offs like pumpkin for the season. The waitress was wonderful and busy.
author: Crystal C.

description:
We arrived in San Francisco for vacation and we were looking for something to eat before we could drive out to Napa. I was in the mood for some Thai so I looked to Yelp for some help in finding something around us.

The area we happened to be in had a lot of places to choose from but Siam Lotus seemed to have one of the better ratings so we decided to give it a try. I went with my go to Pad See Ew. Unfortunately I was left pretty disappointed. Sauce could have used more flavor. It tasted very bland and they didn't offer a spice level. It could have used more sauce over all because it was a little dry.

While the food didn't hit the mark for me I will say that the staff was very nice. They were very attentive and extremely nice.
author: Lexi N.

description: I almost always avoid eating on the Haight and this place is a perfect example of why: subpar food at stupid tourist prices. Bland $17 curry with undercooked potatoes, sour papaya salad. With how high the bar is for Thai food in SF in general, you can safely avoid this place.
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
This is a great Thai place in downtown SF. We ordered the Veggie Spring roll and a Pad Kee Maw. The spice level was below average so make sure to tell them "Spicy" if you want medium spicy. 
The Spring rolls were one of the best we had in a long time. The quantity is adequate and the people are very welcoming. 
Definitely recommend!!
author: Gopal I.

description:
Randomly stumbled upon this place after shopping at amoeba & we're glad we did.

Here's what we ordered :

Grilled lemongrass chicken w green papaya salad & sticky rice $14.25 spice level 3
So good! The chicken wasn't very spicy @ a 3 so we asked for extra chili, but the papaya salad was. Great mix over the sticky rice & such good flavor - perfect white meat chicken.

Spicy rice noodle w chicken $12 spice level 4
We also added more Spice to this one, but it had such good flavor and a nice veggie mix.

The ladies were so nice and attentive, we'll be back!
author: danielle a.

description: We stopped in this place while we were checking out Haight Ashbury. It looked unassuming from the outside but we were hungry and it was right there. I ordered the salmon and Brussel sprouts and it was amazing! The flavor was so good, the price was decent and the service was great. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Tabitha M.

description: This is the take out plate.  Should have been crispy chicken with rice, pineapples and raisins.  The rice really need more flavoring.  You have to get there early to get the crispy chicken.  I was happier last tome with the cashew chicken.  The chicken wasn't as dry as it was last night.  Prices comparable, but this particular meal I think was over priced.
author: Diane L.

description:
No waits. Good amount of street parking on weekdays. Huge selection to choose from. Check out the Specials section on the menu. 

Shared: 
Northern Chicken Curry Noodle (khao soi)
Drunken asparagus noodle with pork

The Northern Curry Noodle was tasty and flavorful ! Loved the pickled mustard on top. The dish was a little spicy. Just perfect for me. Appetizing and delicious. Highly recommend. The Drunken Pork asparagus Noodle was average. Lacked a little flavor. Both of the noodles were cooked well. Their portions are a decent size. Definitely satisfied my Thai craving with the khao soi. The service is quick and pleasant. I like this place, I'll be back when I'm in the area.
author: Karen L.

description: Amazing Thai! We were so surprised about it since we randomly selected it when passing by (we normally check Yelp first). We ordered prawn Pai Thai and another plate with chicken curry, both to share. Everything was so good and the service was professional, very friendly and very helpful (she reminded us about the peanuts and egg in one of the ordered dishes, just to make sure none of us was allergic to it). 100% recommendable!
author: Claudia L.

description: Very affordable and the server and greater were both very kind. The pork belly and Pannang Curry was delicious. Must share the coconut ice cream with a fried banana. It's been a long time since I have received wonderful service. Parking is very challenging, but welcome to San Francisco.
author: Jo E.

description:
This Thai dish was delish 

Appetizer: 
- Thai Tacos

Meal: 
- Mango Thai Basil

We chose this place because of the awards and accolades it received. We started with the Thai Tacos (voted best in 2017) and were not disappointed. It was an interesting take on Tacos with Thai food and it was yummy. Make sure you put some of the cucumber/carrot on it because that's where the sauce is.

The mango Thai basil was good but my only complaint would be there wasn't enough of it. I'd say 75% of the plate was rice and 25% was the meat, mango and basil. Of the 25%, 75% was mango. I like a lot of protein in my food so this was slightly a let down. I did like how it tasted, just wish there was more to eat!
author: Isaac A.

description: Service was pretty slow and the curry only had tofu with zero veggies. It's an okay substitute if Ploy II is closed.
author: Christy T.

description: Amazing food and very friendly staff!!! We ordered Chicken satay, rolls and Panang curry. All of them were delicious
author: Nancy86 B.

description: Such a gem in the Haight. The ladies here are so welcoming and polite. Made us feel right at home
author: Albert C.

description: This place is so Bomb! I couldn't believe how amazing the Pad Thai and Pad Kee Mao were. Just the differences in flavors and the perfect way they combine the spices was crazy. Beautiful and such hospitable waitress. 5/5 and will mosdefinately was returning
author: Shaun B.

description:
Best Thai in Upper Haight, service is also wonderful.

A couple of my favorites:
Pineapple Kisses
Pad See Ew
Pumpkin Curry or the other one when pumpkins aren't in season (they'll recommend it for you)
author: Tim D.

description:
My girlfriend and i came here for her birthday and our anniversary because the thai restaurant across the street was closed until 3pm. We ordered the chicken pad thai and it was tasteful. She ordered the chicken curry and no complaints have occured. We also got the thai tea float. The scoop of ice cream was coconut flavored and it went well with the thai tea ! 

The servers were nice and gave terrific service ! This place is very casual and family friendly. Good for kids. Whenever we're in town, we're definitely coming back!
author: Nancy L.

description: The restaurant is right in the middle of Haight street, in between all the funky Tibetan gift shops. Apart from the surrounded funkiness, the restaurant is not very good for their food.
author: Aswin V.

description:
Friendly people. High quality food and ingredients. Great value for the price. We've been twice in two days and will come again.

UPDATE: We've now been back several more times and we still love the place. One of our favorites.
author: Seth C.

description: I was really set on only going to one Thai place since getting to the neighborhood- mostly out of finding it and liking it. But... as we were walking around The Haight we stumbled upon Siam Lotus. Quickly, we checked the yelp reviews and they looked great- so we went in on a sleepy Saturday afternoon. WOW. This place is super good! We ordered the duck fried rice and the pad see ew. They let you adjust the spice you want to make it perfect- we went with mild and were very pleased. The oil that ends up on the food isn't so much that you feel it covering your lips as you chow down on those noodles/rice.. but it is just enough to give it taste. I would even go as far as saying this tastes "cleaner" than other Thai I've had in general. This place was so good it is now in the list of go-to places for takeout. Which by the way, is super easy to order through their website. Overall, a fantastic Thai place and great food.
author: Nadia H.

description: Mediocre food. My friend and I both had two famous Thai dishes: the Pad See Ew and the Pad Thai. It was just okay. The vegetables were cut too big, the bean sprouts weren't fresh and crunchy, and the flavors were bland. San Francisco is full of great restaurants. If I could go back in time, I would go elsewhere.
author: Marissa L.

description:
This is your average Thai food joint. My dad and I needed to grab a bite in The Haight and decided to check this place out. 

I went with the veggie pad thai without egg. While they piled on the veggies, what my dish did lack was flavor. It was quite oily-- more oily than any other pad thai I've had. The noodles were cooked well and I enjoyed the tofu that accompanied the dish but probably wouldn't order it again. With all of this said, the portions are quite large here and the service is quick and pleasant. Wasn't quite memorable but didn't have a terrible experience by any means.
author: Nicole A.

description:
We went for dinner today after 9pm, as this was one of them opened late night. Ambience is really good, with big enough bar. We were welcomed and seated immediately. Since we weren't hungry, we ordered couple of entrees, spicy basil friend rice and red curry directly without any appetizers. Guess due to late night with not much crowd around, food was served within 5-10 mins. 

Dishes:
* Spicy basil fried rice - we were very disappointed with the portion served though it tasted good. 
* Red curry - Portion was decent though both of us felt it was too much coconuty which was honestly quite overwhelming and not able to consume it after few bites. we had way better red curry elsewhere. 

Overall, this place is ok once in a while, but may not be one of our go-to place next time.
author: Swepna M.

description: My favorite Thai in town. Amazing food and great service! The owner make you feel like home! Amazing Thai experience in the US.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Seriously good authentic Thai food.  I had the crispy pork belly goodness and it was outstanding.  I strongly recommend it.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
Oi Vey. Not good. Lunch with 2 companions: 

Pad Thai: substandard with noodles that must have come from the vendors bargain bin

Papaya salad: Tiny portion... many ingredients from WW2, papaya slices ready to expire

Sweet and Sour (pork): ODD. Soggy fried pork pieces soaked in the vinegar sauce

Duck Soup: reported be be OK
 
Shulda got a clue when we arrived and we were the ONLY table with people in the restaurant @ Noon. Put my jacket on a chair on the table next to me and Server/Owner/Ms.ThaiLand 1952 took it off and handed it back to me. Odd since we were the ONLY people in the restaurant.  She had the aggressive attitude of: "HEY I have a restaurant on Haight Street, you eat what I serve and pay the price". Disappointing. BAD service. Bad Food. Bad big price. BAD BAD BAD. Oh, and the fake 4 & 5 * reviews won't help this joint.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Solid Thai in the Haight. This came as a recommendation from a local right down the road. The exact words were, skip Hippie Thai and walk the few extra blocks and you know what...I'd tell you the exact same thing.

Siam Lotus is a tiny restaurant that offers an awesome gluten free selection. Though their isn't a menu for it, the waitress will tell you exactly what you can and cannot have. She will also check to see if something can be made gluten free for you. To me, that was a huge perk and I really appreciated her going out of the way for me.  

Thai Basil is the way to go. This dish was perfectly spicy and filled my craving for an awesome Thai meal. I wish it came with rice, but that is something that could have easily been fixed on my part.
author: Kendal Ann M.

description:
I've been to my fair share of Thai restaurants and honestly I've had better. 

The food here is ok. It was not worth the price I paid for. I got rice, chicken wings, Thai tea and pad kee mao and it came out to 30$! I mean if the food was good then I wouldn't have complained but it wasn't. 

I got the Thai basil chicken wings (best dish of the two) and I got the asparagus pad kee mao noodles (disappointing). Both dishes especially the pad kee mao dish were more on the bland side. Their Thai tea was too sweet for me. 

The service was nice, the lady who served my friend and I was so sweet and brought everything that we asked for. 

To find parking will be challenging so expect to drive around for a while. It is metered parking so bring coins!
author: Myly H.

description:
My partner and I come here once a week, and are finally giving Siam Lotus what we owe it--a glowing, five-star review. First, let's talk about the food. We've tried nearly everything on their large, vegetarian-friendly menu, have never been disappointed. (Seriously, I just glanced over the menu again, and could make an argument for choosing just about anything.) It's also a great place to stay for dessert: I'd highly recommend the black sticky rice and coconut ice cream. 

Plus, especially for a restaurant right on Haight, it's never too crowded and has a warm, neighborhoody vibe. Service is fast, and the staff are always super friendly and already know our drink order (two Chang beers). When our friend visited from out of town, Siam Lotus was the first place we wanted to bring her, and they made her feel right at home--even giving her a sack full of Thai chilis and a six-pack of beer glasses as a gift. Basically, it's the cozy, family-owned Thai restaurant of your dreams.
author: Emma E.

description:
DELICIOUS COMFORT FOOD. Very well seasoned. Just hands down best meal I've had in SF. I ordered the chicken pad Thai. My friends had veggie curry, golden curry, and the chefs special -salmon with garlic and chard. Tried all of it and it all was on point. 

As if that isn't enough, the staff here is soo nice and satisfaction oriented. I left with a little left over for my trip back to LA and I don't feel gross-full or bloated. 

This is the type of place to have dinner if you want to be taken care of genuinely. I highly recommend this spot.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I am between a 2.5 and a 3 .
Thai tea was pretty good . It was better than a lot of other places i have had and this is probably what contributed most to my rating .
Calamari was okay ~ just average but the sauce it came with was interesting and different however .
Mint salad with chicken tasted like it had fish sauce in it so if you arent a fan of that taste i would not recommend it . It tastes better than it smells and tastes better wrapped in the lettuce .
I also got asparagus drunken noodle spicy lvl 4 . Overall it was not too spicy but it had chili in it that burned my tongue due to its spiciness ! It was not too flavorful otherwise . 
Portions are pretty good and big but i dont think the food was that flavorful or anything special .
author: Julia K.

description: This place is the bomb! Chef's Special Northern Curry Noodles are unique. We'll be back.
author: Vaibhav M.

description:
This teeters more towards a 3.5 star, but going off of what Yelp gives me the options for. 

A pretty quiet spot in the Haight area. Came here with a group of three and got seated immediately. We were craving Thai food all day so we immediately ordered a few appetizers to split and our own entrees

Calamari - 3/5 decent and nothing too special. They had a sweet sticky dipping that had a nice little flavor kick to it

Minced chicken with mint salad - 4/5 tasted fresh and had a fish sauce kick to it, I think. So if you're not familiar with that flavor, be wary of this dish. Otherwise, it had a healthy flavor and was great wrapped up in the lettuce leaves. 

Drunken noodles with asparagus - 3/5 they ask you what level of spice you want (1-5), and I'm pretty tolerant of my spice so I got a 4 and it definitely had a nice kick to it to help clear up those sinuses, but aside from the spicy factor, there really wasn't too much flavor with these noodles unfortunately :( had to ask for side sauces to douse the noodles in to get it more flavorful

Overall, it was an average experience with average service
author: Jay P.

description: Best Thai Food on Haight Street!  Couldn't have been a better date night.
author: Jason W.

description:
Very delicious curried masumen squash! Best I've had in years. 
Service was nice and quick, and I felt just fine going by myself while visiting San Francisco for a conference.
author: Sally B.

description: Ate late lunch here after SF Aids Walk. Took bus here since we knew there would be limited parking. Nice decor. Service excellent. Entrees ordered (curry chicken and catfish)  tasted excellent. Smaller cafe and no wifi.
author: Clifford W.

description:
4.5!

The service here was so pleasant! And I def the decor is very cute.

Def enjoyed the duck fried rice and lemongrass chicken. Presentation was so pretty. We came here around 12 on a Friday before the king rush and the food came right out.

Be forewarned: on the menu it kindly states there are only 2 people cooking so please be prepared to wait a little if the restaurant is busy. 

Would def come back if I'm ever in The Haight.
author: Jo Ann D.

description: Great Thai food! Wonderful for kids! We ordered pad Thai and chicken from the starters for the kids. For us we ordered the veggie green curry and the chicken with papaya salad from the chef's specials. All was great!
author: Moran G.

description: We took a friend to birthday dinner here, but the food didn't reach our expectations. The coconut soup was thin. However, one of the special offerings stood out - sweet and sour seafood deep fried with bell peppers.  I think the addition of bowls of heavy brown rice were too filling and we could barely get through the Green Bean Prig King which did not have a well defined sauce. Hospitality was good.
author: Carolyn D.

description:
Wow! Can't believe I haven't rated this place. It's my favorite go-to for Thai in the city *and* just happens to be around the corner from my pad. 

Things I order:
- Crispy Chicken and Pineapple Fried Rice (holy yum)
- Pad Thai (the best)
- Spicy Basil Eggplant w/ Fried Tofu
- Coconut Soup (yes)
- Green Papaya Salad
- Northern Curry Noodles (spicy!)
- Duck Curry (when I can afford it)
- Duck Fried Rice
- Golden Triangle

I've had some dishes that I'm not crazy about but everything is solid, and "crazy" in the context of I *LOVE* the dishes listed above. The staff is always super sweet and kind. 

I've also taken lots of veg friends here and it's a place that works really well! 
They do lots of takeout business in the neighborhood, which keeps the place itself really mellow and the wait is never that long for a table.
author: snowhappy P.

description: Mediocre thai food at best but what really killed it was the waitress. Don't really like leaving one star reviews but felt this was important since it was a combination of bad service, mediocre food, and bad service.
author: David F.

description:
#1 in Upper Haight.

Upper Haight doesn't really have great food options, but Siam Lotus is an exception to that.  This is a super solid Thai spot, and not only is it the best Thai place in the Haight (beating the decent, but not spectacular, Ploy II), it's just the best place to eat in the Haight period.  It always hits the spot, never disappoints.

As a plus, aside from the normal Thai stuff (i.e. Pad Thai), it does have some less standard options, such as the Crispy Chicken with Pineapple Fried Rice which I highly recommend.
author: Max B.

description:
Holy s#!* that was delicious. Everything. All of it. Even the music was good. We came on a lazy Sunday afternoon right after a large group had walked in, but the food came out fast, regardless. Our waitress and the owner(?) were extremely friendly, too.
Highly recommended.
author: Gabriel V.

description:
Omg ! I had the best Drunken asparagus which was so delicious  
They are lovely and welcoming people and food served very quickly.
It could be a perfect spot for vegan options.
author: Violet D.

description: Its a sweet family run place. Had the spring rolls and the pad thai. Both were average. Didn't love it. The portions are also decent sizes.
author: Ashmita V.

description:
The Pineapple Fried Rice with added Shrimp here was lackluster and tasteless. I suspect that they used canned pineapple, the shrimp was sparse and fishy tasting, and the rice was barely seasoned and contained no other ingredients - besides 4 shrimp and about 9 cashews. 

I was so disappointed in this dish - that I picked out the shrimp and left the rest. I prefer to indulge in carbs that delight my tastebuds - rather than dull them.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I had a late lunch here. I started off with some Golden Triangles, which were somewhat unconvincing. They appear to be a potato-filled take on the classic "Golden Bag" thai starter. Then I had the Golden Curry, which was apparently something of a house specialty, owing to its strong coconut flavor. That was pretty good. I also had a thai ice tea, which was perfectly fine. Overall, this was nothing outstanding, but my meal was filling and reasonably tasty.
author: John L.

description: Very attentive staff!  I ordered Drunken Asparagus Noodle.  On the bland side till I added some chili paste.  Good flavors but ila little on the greasy side.
author: GARY T.

description:
I LOVE this place! Great Thai food. It's a gem!

Huge menu and the service is fast. Lots of choices for a vegetarian!

They ask spice level and they are spicier than most Thair places so go easy. I eat quite a bit spicy and I got a level-3 and it was perfect. Level-4 would be much higher than what I would like. 

1. Golden Triangle - these are potato filled Thair Samosa. They were okay. Nothing special. 

2. Pad kee mow ($11) - loved it! Highly recommend it. I got it with tofu and it was delicious! 

Their portions are big so you may not finish.
author: Hiral P.

description:
This place is very good, I think. There were many dishes you can choose.
We ordered four dishes and they were delicious. You also can decided the taste of the food. So humanized! Both of us enjoyed a good dinner! Will come back soon.
author: William D.

description:
The plates look nice,  but the food is not good.  We are used to Thai restaurants and we have tasted a bunch of Thais around San Francisco,  this one is not cheap and the worst we have tasted so far.  
We ordered :
Mango Thai basil with shrimp : you won't get more than what's in the title,  and the shrimps were not thoroughly cooked. 
Coconut pad Thai : bland and fatty ,  even adding spicy sauce and tons of salt 
Thai Tom Tim noodle soup: the smell was not good and the taste was...   
Go to the one on the other side of the street,  with the stairs, it was closed and we ended up here,  double disappointment.
author: Adelaide B.

description:
We eat takeout from Siam regularly.

Recommendations are on point! They suggested the Drunken Asparagus one day and we really appreciated the suggestion, it's now a new favorite. 

We've tried various curries, noodle dishes, and more. Everything is good. Preference for noodle over rice dishes. Generally, this place is a crowd pleaser.

It's generally very easy to get a table for 2-6 right away without waiting (maybe larger groups as well, we just are usually not a big group). The ambiance is casual and well kept but nothing special. It's a good place to hang out and the service is always good.

Glad to live nearby
author: Sarah C.

description: Good Thai place to go up in Haight. Not the best Thai food, but it's okay. Service was quick and it was reasonable.
author: James D.

description: Absolutely some of the most delicious Thai food I've ever had. Their homemade peanut sauce recipe is to die for.
author: Mollie H.

description:
The best Crab Fried Rice I've ever had.

I randomly dined in here with my girlfriend to kill time before a book event down the street. We were craving Thai and this was one of the few that were walking distance from The Booksmith.

I consider crab fried rice a waste of money because crab meat tends to have a subtle flavor, the flavor gets drowned out when mixed in a fried rice dish, ultimately rendering the dish into a regular fried rice.

This place, however, does Crab Fried Rice amazingly. Not only can you taste the crab, you can smell its aroma as well! Very appetizing and delicious and I highly recommend it.

Another great dish they have is their chicken wings. Perfect combo with the fried rice.
author: Oliver D.

description: Mediocre food in surprisingly small portions for the price that you pay! You will better Thai food in most other Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Yali W.

description: Very good fairly priced Thai! Very good at providing appropriately spicy food and friendly service. I ad the drunken noodles with asparagus , I would come back again
author: John W.

description:
Decent Thai. 

I ordered Tofu Pad Thai and my boyfriend had Chicken Pad See Ew. It was not bad, but nothing to get too excited about. 
 
I ordered my Pad Thai spicy. The waitress repeatedly warned me that it would be extremely spicy, and wouldn't let me order it too spicy. I should've stuck to what I know (I eat thai frequently AND I've been to Thailand). I ended up adding more hot sauce to it. However... she did let my boyfriend order his dish spicy. It was indeed spicy & sweat inducing. (Clearly, a little bitter about that.)

The restaurant had one, maybe 2, other couples in it and the service was slow. It took a while for someone to take our order and the food came out slowly. I don't know how they would handle a full house. 

Overall, decent. Not itching to go back.
author: Caroline L.

description: Not bad. Food isn't bad..so so, but, the location pretty key, and the staff is very very nice. Check it out for yourself.
author: Thet M.

description: In upper Haight there are many options for noodles and thai food but Siam Lotus is my go to neighborhood spot. They are super fast and have a very diverse menu, though I must admit I don't venture away from my mainstays: pad thai, pad see ew & panang curry. They are spot on and worth repeating.
author: Molly S.

description:
Although I live in San Jose, every time  I go to the city I end up eating at Siam Lotus. Everything I have eaten on the menu is delicious !!!!! They have classic Thai dishes like curries, twists on classics( coconut pad Thai), and different dishes ( ginger catfish). You can taste the freshness and love in the cooking, something I search for in a restaurant. They even sell some of their sauces to go ... I'm hooked on the salad dressing !

Great food, great location, and awesome people/service ! :)
author: Daria V.

description: This is my favorite local Thai place. I've liked every dish I've tried there, and the crispy chicken and pineapple fried rice has become my go-to comfort food. The staff is very friendly, and they've also been very accommodating and conscientious of a peanut allergy in our family (a risky proposition in a Thai place). They also tend to get the food out lightning quick.
author: Pat M.

description:
Terrible food, rude service.

Thai food is a favorite of mine so when we passed this place we decided to stop for a snack on a whim, and we were very disappointed. 

At first the service was friendly enough and our drinks came out fast. I ordered chicken satay and a bowl of tom Kha for my boyfriend and I.  When I ordered she asked if we were sharing and I said yes, assuming she meant for an extra spoon.

The food was pretty bad. The chicken satay had clearly not been marinated and tasted boiled-not at all like the flavorful meat I experience most places. The cucumber salad with it also seemed tossed together and lacking on flavor. Even the peanut sauce was sub par.

The tom Kha lacked coconut flavor weirdly and was very short on both vegetables and chicken. I believe it must have had milk since shortly after eating I got a migraine that I get when I consume dairy. The portion was large, which surprised us but we figured out why when we got the bill.

The menu says only 'individual soups' and shows the price as $5. I thought that would be perfect for a snack. It does not say any sizes or use the word 'cup' of 'bowl'. When we got the bill we had been charged $9.59. Normally I wouldn't say anything but I didn't love being charged for something we barely ate that was terrible, so we politely asked about why it wasn't the menu price and she turned incredibly rude and told me I ordered wrong and should've said cup if I wanted a small portion. My boyfriend asked her politely despite her rudeness why the menu didn't show a large size if she was charging for it, or at least didn't say 'cup' or 'bowl'. Then she said that she asked if we were sharing,so she gave us more. She was incredibly rude and kept telling me that I ordered wrong.

We both work in restaurants and know that you should never double the price of an item without informing the person. If the $9.50 price wasn't on the menu then you should ask if they want a larger portion for a higher price, not just assume that they want an off menu size and will pay for it.

It was clearly a scam, but even worse was how terrible she acted when we politely asked about it. Do not trust this place.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Beware. They overcharged my credit card. While I can't prove it was intentional, as you'll see below, it sure looks that way.

I ordered takeout. State law says cooks don't share in tips; it was the cooks who did all the work on my order (not the servers), so I usually leave no tip or just a little one in this situation. 

So I added a $1.16 tip on the $22.34 order. As you'll see in my photo (a scan of the credit card bill and the receipt the restaurant sent the credit card company), they entered this $1.16 tip as $4.00. How can that have been a typo or an entry error? Those two sets of numbers are nowhere near each other on the keypad. 

The dollar amount here is small. But it's the principle. And if they did this to me, to how many other customers have they done this as well?

[Update: one of the owners emailed me, apologized profusely, and offered this explanation: "We line our credit card bills by number order and yours was most likely misplaced within the pile. Therefore a different order's tip was added to your bill." You be the judge, but it's always good practice to double check those credit card bills].
author: Tim B.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend Saturday night; no wait for seating. It's a small place that doesn't look fancy, but the food was fantastic. I got the prawn pad Thai and she got scarlet roast duck curry. We shared the Thai tacos for an appetizer. We both eat lots of Thai, pho, and Indian in Vegas and this place was right on par with our favorite restaurants. Total bill was just under $40 for 2.
Getting a side of rice for the curry was a good idea, and if you're unsure what to try just get pad Thai - it's simple and made so well that anyone will enjoy it.
author: Eric S.

description:
Ordered via Grubhub, which was a breeze, but I was pretty disappointed in the food. I'm a big Thai food fan, but had never eaten here, despite it being a short jaunt from my house. Grubhub told me the veggie spring rolls and the pad thai were popular, so I got em. They're also pretty common at Thai places, so figured they'd be a good benchmark.

Unfortunately, they both fell short. The spring rolls were plain, but made better with sweet and sour sauce. Still not worth it to get three small spring rolls (three!) for $8 (eight dollars!). The pad thai was a healthier portion. I ordered shrimp as the protein, which, if you've ever ordered anything with shrimp, you know they're not going to give you as many shrimp as you want. This was actually a surprising exception! However, didn't change the fact that the pad thai was not that great. While some thai noodles veer too far into greasy/salty/spicy as hell, I would have gladly taken that over whatever this was.

Despite the convenience, probably won't be heading back. Stars for the quantity of shrimp/noodles and the inclusion of sweet and sour with the spring rolls. An additional half star in spirit for the ease of Grubhub, but I think Grubhub earned that all for itself.
author: Julien I.

description: This Thai place is fantastic! We originally were going to head over to Cha Cha Cha (which is other gem) had a hankering for Thai. Ordered the Thai tacos, Mango Thai Basil-Chicken and Lemongrass chicken. Perfect for 2. Sweet mamasan waitress took our order :) ample seating, great for groups.
author: Corinne S.

description: The food is great! The service is quick & they're very friendly. If you're a Haight local this is a gem. One time, I even came in 6 minutes before closing & they graciously took my order. Enjoy!
author: Candice N.

description: The tofu pad thai was so bland I think they may have forgotten the sauce. I had one bite and couldn't finish it, it tasted like nothing. Would maybe be willing to try again since this place has pretty decent reviews but completely unimpressed by the pad thai.
author: Katie C.

description: Thai food rarely wows me, and I rarely crave it. When I do, I usually stick with my go-to pad thai or potato curry. Went with the latter this time, and it was very creamy (full of coconut milk, I'm sure). The soup that we shared was also very creamy, and even though coconut milk isn't dairy, it still turns my stomach the wrong way. So I had a bit of a tummy ache that night :( But food was pretty good - just nothing special.
author: Kathy L.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the neighborhood! Good value for money, amazing service and yummy food.
author: Mar R.

description: Came for dinner and our food came out within around 10 minutes which was very nice because we were in a rush to go to a show (obviously not a good idea to sit in and dine when you're on a time crunch but whatevs!). Good the coconut pad Thai and the half moon bay sugar pumpkin curry both with chicken. The coconut pad Thai was sweet from the coconut milk they put it in and the noodles aren't the usual thin rice noodles but rather the wide kinds, an interesting surprise! It was good overall. The pumpkin curry had a good kick to it, just slight but yummy. Lots of pumpkin too! I'd come back :) they seem like really nice people too!
author: Christine L.

description: When I used to come here many, many years ago, they made a crispy Thai basil chicken (not the wings). It was to die for. PLEASE bring it back
author: Chris M.

description: The waitress was super nice, gave good advice on what to pick. The price ranges are from $8-18. Good for medium parties. A good place to go if you are around the Golden Gate Park.
author: Florence D.

description: Some of the best Pad Kee Mow we have ever had. Veggie curry great too. Server hustles and is very friendly. Love the Thai iced tea.
author: Kathryn P.

description:
They surprised me every time I came here, either for lunch or dinner. 
Environment: It's clean, not so loud. For sure you would see a lot interesting people on the Haight.
Service: friendly and lovely. Most of time there are 2 people serving, so the service is quite slow during peek hours, but absolutely not lousy at all.
Food: amazing! I have difficult time to decide what I want to order here because everything is so good, like home cook. Some spectacular dishes I have tried:
- Northern Curry Egg Noodle (Kao Soi)
- Coconut Pad Thai: it's not regular pad thai, it's more than that, with very great curry sauce
- Grilled Beef Salad
- Panang Curry
- Green Bean Prik King

I will come back, surely!
author: Phuong P.

description: We love this place. Been going to this place for past 6 years since very close to where we live and enjoy their delicious dishes every single time. Highly recommend!
author: Punit S.

description:
Glad we came in! Food came out fast, thai tea was great. Mango tofu and pineapple chicken were good as well. And it was affordable! 

What really made it was the service. They were very nice, accommodating, and helpful! And filled up out water a lot :)
author: Bayley S.

description: I had the pad se ew with chicken. Probably the least tasty pad se ew I've ever had. 0% flavor. Just finished the meal and I'm pretty bummed.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Healthy clean fresh tasteful lunch!! The best Thai I have been to yet!! Fresh local seasonal ingredients infused with the traditional Thai cuisine! The owner was our waitress, she was very friendly and knowledgeable and proud of her restaurant! Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Sandi I.

description:
Came with a group of ~15 on a Sunday night (~6pm) and surprisingly it was empty. Great service overall.
Roast duck fried rice is so good here. Coconut soup was also delicious.
Would come again.
author: Elisa L.

description:
During our family vacation to San Francisco, we found this place using the "Around Me" iPhone app when we were walking Haight Street on Wed. August 5, 2015. In fact, it caught my eye because I though they might be related to Lotus of Siam in Las Vegas where I've dined before. Turns out, it is not related - but who cares? This was a wonderful Thai dinner!

I started with the Hot & Sour Soup and ordered it extra spicy. They repeatedly warned me that it would be extremely spicy, but I paid no heed and said "bring it on anyway!" Actually, they were right - it was delicious, albeit extremely spicy as they warned.....I ate it all anyway, and my sinuses were completely cleared :-)

Next was the Crab Fried Rice. Just awesome. Fresh and fluffy...it felt very healthy. 

My wife hadn't had Thai food before, so she ordered the Chicken Curry Butternut Squash since it sounded simple and familiar. She totally loved it.

The service was excellent too. Two ladies served us, one of which was "Nart" the owner. Both ladies were extremely nice and attentive. We were there early in the evening, so it hadn't gotten crowed yet, so I don't know if we would have gotten the same attentiveness if they were really busy. 

All said, this was a marvelous dinner - we'd go back again in a heartbeat next time we're in San Fran!
author: Darren L.

description: We had the chicken panang curry and the chicken pineapple fried rice. Both of them were amazing. Specially loved the latter. The place is very clean and the people who work here are super nice and friendly.
author: Joyeta S.

description: My go to Thai spot in the Upper Haight, I love everything but can't stop getting the Emerald Curry.
author: Andrew A.

description: Service was very slow, they ran out of flat noodles and chicken wings and Food was very salty or so bland. Clearly, their was no balance of flavor unfortunately. This restaurant is a very Americanized Thai restaurant and is definitely not authentic!! My family and I ordered the pad Thai, basil chicken, duck fried rice and spicy eggplant with fried tofu. The pad Thai wasn't even orange In color and it lack that depth of flavor other Thai restaurants have. Originally we ordered their chicken wings, but they came back 20 minutes later saying they ran out so instead we ordered their Basil chicken. BIG MISTAKE! The chicken was too salty that it was almost unpalatable. The spicy egg plant with fried tofu was a huge disappointment, Panda Express version of eggplant and tofu taste so much better!!! There again lack depth of flavor and spicy. And the eggplant looked like it was boiled rather than stir fried. The only dish that was mediocre at best was their duck fried rice. They had ample amount of duck in their fried rice. However way too much 5spice!
author: Roseanne V.

description: I really loved my experience here, came to have a late night dinner with my boyfriend and we were welcomed even tho the kitchen was closing in 15 minutes.  I ordered drunken asparagus noodles and and the roasted duck it was a delicious blend of orgasmic flavors,  sheer poetry.  I highly recommend this place and will definitely be returning on my next visit today San Fran.
author: Lauren P.

description:
For what it is and where it is, this place is awesome. The food is all fully flavored and the portions are fairly large. The place feels like a neighborhood restaurant and the service is always really kindhearted. 

All of the curry dishes are good. I have had them all and the Emerald Curry with prawns is by far my favorite. I have never had a bad bite of food here ever. The appetizers are all great. I love the Thai tacos, fried shrimp rolls and the golden triangles.

This place is a great spot to go grab a bite to eat in a relaxed setting, but it also is a great spot to pick something up when you don't feel like cooking and want something relatively healthy..
author: Ben M.

description: I've come here several times for lunch with colleagues. It was highly recommended and now I know why. The food is fantastic and the service is great. They are incredibly friendly and the food came out rather quickly. I've had the sticky garlic pork. WOW. This is always a go-to dish for me at Thai restaurants, and this might be one of the best I've had so far. Excellent quality. Lots of toasted garlic which was meant for both flavor and decoration! The sauce was so lovely. I could just eat that sticky pork glaze without the pork over rice alone! A must-try! I also enjoyed their prig-king with pork. Also very tasty... some heat as well! Each of these dishes come with a house salad. The "rice plates" are mostly $8.95. Definitely a good spot for a quick and delicious bite in the Haight!
author: James Z.

description:
I came to eat here with my boyfriend and a friend. It was still early for dinner, but we decided to eat anyway.  I ordered a Thai iced coffee and the pad-see-ew.  Upon ordering, they advised that they ran out of the thicker noodles.  That was a huge disappointment.  Especially since it was still early for dinner.  So, they offered to use the thinner noodles. I said ok, because I was really craving for the flavor of the pad see ew. 

The Thai coffee was filled to the top and seemed a lot stronger than most Thai places.  I had to request more milk or half and half.  

I guess the thicker noodles make a difference in the dish? The dish was lacking that nice stir fry flavor.  I don't know if it's because the thinner noodles are more moist when cooking?  Either way, the dish was a bit bland for my taste and it made me regret agreeing to substitute the thicker noodles.  I should have just ordered something else.

I'm not normally in the Haight area, but I think I'll give another restaurant a chance instead of coming back.

Service was good, although when one of the ladies brought us plates, one of the plate had some rice residue stuck in the center.  I guess they don't check the plates to make sure it's really clean after they wash it??
author: R. A. D.

description: This place was great, server was amazing they made great suggestion!! Ask for server name Minnee and Bly, she's really nice! I ordered pad see ew and shrimp rolls with ice coffee, which was strong!!!
author: Mo I.

description: I was craving Thai food and this was just okay. I had the veggie pad see ew. Very friendly service!
author: Maggie N.

description: Though the signs said that there are only two people in the back and service might be slow, they were really quite timely with our meal. Ordered the street corner pork, which had a spicy dipping sauce that had an awesome kick to it. Definitely worth a try for an appetizer. Extremely friendly staff, flavorful food and nice ambience.
author: Abe L.

description:
My second time eating here! Recommended by a local crystal shop owner. 
Service and food are always great. :)
author: Victoria D.

description: Good service, but the food was very "American Thai". I missed some authentic thaifood there.
author: Camilla J.

description:
The food was all really good. My only hangup was the two pubes I found in my noodles. At first I was like whatever it's one pube. Then I found another one and couldn't eat anymore and didn't take my leftovers. 

Pube me once, shame on me. Pube me twice...shame on you Siam Lotus. Shame.
author: Skylar N.

description: I just bought a tom gai kai soup at this place to go, worst Thai soup experience ever. $10.50 for a 2/3 full round plastic soup container with 6 pieces of chicken and a few mushrooms, ridiculous rip off with all due respect. Several ingredients missing like snow peas etc. I'm doing a social media campaign against this place unless they fess up..
author: Steiner A.

description:
We have tried more than 10 Thai Food restaurants in the city and NONE have come close to Siam Lotus in terms of quality and flavor. We have also been to Thailand several times and experienced authentic Thai cuisine and Siam Lotus definitely delivers similar quality and flavor profiles in so many of their dishes.

The location in The Haight is a bit grungy, as per the usual for this location, and the physical space itself is average but the food combined with the hospitable service will inspire you to come back time and time again. The staff aims to please, and the owner/chef will wow you with all of her dishes.

Some of our favorite items:

Larb Gai (Chicken Salad): amazing flavors and very fresh!

Penang Curry: great with any protein, this dish is rich in flavor and very tasty!

Street Pork (appetizer): grilled pork with immense flavor, some of the best I've had!

Pricing is reasonable and it's easy to get a table. Give it a try!
author: Bryant W.

description:
Small little Thai place in Haight.

Me and my friends were just looking for some Thai food and we came across this little hole in the wall. We were the only ones in there so we got served pretty quickly. I ordered the garlic chicken with rice and my friends had some tofu and fish dishes with noodles. I ordered mine medium spicy and it def wasn't spicy enough for me. But the food was pretty good and the price was decent as well. We ordered the fried tofu too and it was pretty yummy... like the dipping sauce.

Don't get the Thai Iced Coffee..it's way too sweet.
author: Krista S.

description: Delicious. Everything we had here was wonderful and delicious. The server was sweet, and knowledgable of the menu. The food was good quality, and was made with love. The ambiance is okay, and there are many cool things to visually stimulate you while you wait. Excellent.
author: Aloysius A.

description:
This place is great, the ambiance is very nook like. When we arrived the place was pretty packed but we got seated fairly quickly. 
I ended up ordering a beef and mint salad, the beef had great flavor and the portion was perfect. But what I didn't like was that the marinating liquid that seeped all the way to the bottom which was crazy salty. To finish off I ordered their coconut ice cream which I fell in love with, highly recommended if you're a coconut lover. (Which I later found out they buy from Mitchell's) 
Overall service was good, and we ended up staying past closing time and never did they rush us to leave, so I greatly appreciated that.
author: Jenny M.

description: Great tasty food, good prices, very friendly service, big portions... My Thai place in SF from now on!
author: Pierre R.

description:
Yum! It's a little, unassuming place - clean, quiet atmosphere, could seat maybe 30. It was about half full when I was there. 

The server got to me promptly, and I chose one of the chef's specials, the drunken asparagus noodles with beef. The dish came out quickly, which was good, because I was sort of in a hurry. Don't get me wrong, though: it was clear that it hadn't been waiting in some big pot under a heating lamp, and that they made it to order.

The rice noodles in the dish were just what you'd expect: wide and somewhat chewy. The vegetables were also good - the asparagus with the bell peppers was a good mix. Really, though, the beef was the best part. I don't know what it was about how they cooked the beef, but it was just right. When I go back, I'll be sure to get another dish, but I'll have a hard time not choosing beef again.
author: Riley A.

description: I love this place. The staff are personable, they care about your experience and want to make sure your food is how you like it. My go to is the panang curry- probably the best I've ever had.
author: Karly D.

description:
Oh well, i've tried so many thai restaurant, and by far, siam lotus is still my first choice. I've tried almost all of their food. And since most of them, or all of them, is delicious, it usually takes me a while to pick my favorites. These come to my mind first though:
-northern curry egg noodle 
-tom yum fried rice
-lap tao hu (tofu salad)
-sticky garlic (beef is the best choice)
-tom yum noodle soup
-mango with black sticky rice (you have to try this!!! Your experience isnt complete unless you end your meal with this dessert!!!)
By the way, their coffee is amazing. I dont normally like thai coffee cuz its sweet, but their coffee has just the right amount of sugar.
author: Alan T.

description: I had a day to kill in Haight Ashbury and stopped in here for lunch on a whim.  So glad I did. Small and quaint dining room. Clean and lots of space between tables. It was a slow paced weekday so there were only a few other diners. Service and food were excellent!   I had the Panang Chicken Curry and it may be the best I've ever had.  Large portion served as a rice plate was perfect for one.  And delicious!  Spicy but not nuclear.  My lips had a nice lingering burn that was quite satisfying.   Great Thai food. Wish I could come back with a group so I could sample more dishes.  Maybe on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Patricia M.

description:
Thai food is almost like the Asian equivalent to pizza for us Americans... it's total comfort food. It makes you feel warm and fuzzy inside. And even when it's not perfect, it really hits the spot.

My friends and I were in need of some nourishment after (timidly) dancing around Amoeba for a free show put on by Thievery Corporation's Rob Garza. We were not shaking our butts as enthusiastically as some other concert-goers, but we were still feelin' it. 

Siam Lotus is a cozy little bistro in the midst of the madness that is Haight-Ashbury. It's a quiet refuge from the manic streets outside its glass window. I felt relaxed immediately after stepping inside. How very zen a place can feel upon first glance. 

The food was yummy. We opted for three different types of curry. I ordered the Tofu Curry, and it was delicious, albeit a bit too mild for my palate. I like it to burn, baby, burn. I shall have to specify to make mine at least medium spicy. 

My favorite part was the fresh coconut water.... served in whole coconuts! They just crack a hole in the top and stick a straw inside. Amazing! Not much actual liquid inside, but the presentation was quite standout.
author: Brandi W.

description: This place is one of the best Thai places that serves one of the best pad thais- hand down. I was starving after a day of running errands and I remember going to this place a couple of years back in Haight and it was pretty good , but I couldn't remember the name. I kept looking up Thai restaurants but nothing. Until I found it yesterday and it's still as good as ever! I ordered the pad thai with shrimp and I for some reason thought the shrimp were going to be these dinky morsels that other restaurants use but no the shrimp was gigantic and although the portion looked small on the plate- it actually was quite filling and I left with left overs. All in all - 5 stars ! Bonus: They have a cute waiter but I don't know his name because he wasn't wearing a name tag.
author: Desiree C.

description:
Truly amazing! This is a charming restaurant with a mom and pop feel to it. I've been here twice for lunch and the staff couldn't be friendlier. It's now my go-to when I have a craving for thai food.

They also have several vegan options on the menu. Actually, I think most of their menu can be made vegan by request (just sub meat for tofu and ask for no egg and fish sauce). I always get nervous that restuarants still use fish sauce in their vegan/vegetarian meals, but the waitress (possibly owner) assured me that she understood and that everything would be made vegan.
 
If nothing else, try the Eastern Thai Veggie appetizer (it will blow your mind). I've also had their pad thai, pad see ew, green bean prig-king and red curry, all of which are great and highly recommended.

I really can't think of anything bad to say about this place. Oh yeah, I just wish it was closer to my apartment!
author: Kelly L.

description:
I love this place! I love that the chef comes out in her white chef's hat and asks if everything is okay? What can she do to make it better? How are the flavors? She really tries and gets to know her customers and explains to me how it is back "home". I've never been to any other restaurant where the chef comes out  and does this. Its so personable that it keeps me coming back.  From the looks of it all her regulars love her and the restaurant just the same!!!

5 stars alone just for the chef!!!

5 stars for the food. Everything is delicious.

***Standouts***
--Northern Curry Noodle
--Roti w/ Curry
--Golden Triangles 
--Lap To Hu -- Eastern Thai Veggie
--Golden Curry with Tofu (Very popular at the restaurant)
--Pad Kee Mao with Tofu (My favorite Thai Dish)
--Wild Cod Emerald Curry (they can make it vegetarian with tofu!!!)

***Standouts not on the Menu***
--Emerald Curry Fried Rice!!! (My all time favorite)

If you are looking for authentic food this is the place to come!!!

Side Note: I hear they have the best Pork Kra Pow (Thai Basil)  in town!!!

With all these yummy foods, whats there not to love!!!

P.S. Happy Hour Beer is $2!!!! From 5pm to 7pm!!!
author: Amber D.

description: First time and last time here. Staff was very friendly and helpful. But the restaurant and its food are old and tired. Cheap eats for sure. I had their standard pad thai. Had I not been super hungry I would not have taken more than a couple bites. There was really no flavor and its presentation was just a blob of noodles in a bowl. Obviously it has beeb around a long time so a lot of people must like it.But I will pass on a second try.
author: Jim P.

description:
It is true.  This really is the best Thai in The Haight.

This nondescript store front blends into the neighborhood so much so I walked past for years and did not stop.  It was not until I was actually staying in this awesome neighborhood that I noticed this place.

This was our annual trip to SF.  We discovered this gem last year.  This year we went 3 times and each visit was more delicious than the last.

We brought a friend, a native and he was like, I have never....
Then we ate and he was like, I will always....
It is THAT good.  And that fresh, and THAT affordable.

I have tried most of the menu and I have not found ONE dish that did not dazzle. 

I have never even felt an ounce of disappointment.

And when all the cool restaurants are busy or if it is Saturday night at 7 you can always find a seat!

Just know I know my Thai and this shit is BOMB.
author: James S.

description:
Came in here for a quick thai fix. The waitress was really kind and attentive! I ordered my usual, Pad Kee Mow, and my bf ordered the Tom Yum Noodle Soup. They asked us how spicy we want it on a scale of 1-5. I picked 2 to be on the safe side. I can tolerate spiciness but I want it to be enjoyable. My boyfriend chose 1. Our food came! The Pad Kee Mow wasn't amazing but it tasted healthier than any of the ones I've eaten. The level 2 spiciness only has a tiny kick. I think I could've went for the 3. I just added the hot sauce on the side to match the level I want. My boyfriend's Tom Yum was delicious! It had a sour-y kick to it like most others. His level 1 spiciness wasn't detected at all so you didn't taste it at all. 

It is at the pricier side for a meal for two. Both were roughly $10.95. Overall, it was good food in a quiet place but the price may be the deal breaker.
author: Amy L.

description:
So it all begins with a failed (and frustrating) attempt to go to the Now and Zen free concert...

Long story short, my boyfriend and I got separated from our friends and while they were able to get into the concert, we were not.  To make matters worst, we carpooled with a friend that got in so we were pretty much going to be stranded until the concert ended.

SOOO of course, instead of moping around and being sad that I was going to miss live performances by One Republic, we decided to look for a place to sit down and eat.  With zero expectations, we stumbled into Siam Lotus.

We ordered the papaya salad, tom kha, a yellow curry, and some mango curry special thing.

THE TOM KHA WAS THE BEST TOM KHA I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!!!! So so so comforting, creamy, and delicious!  It was also the first time I had papaya salad and it was good!  Curries were tasty as well.

TLDR; no free concert but an AWESOME DELICIOUS COMFORTING MEAL.
author: Maggi K.

description:
I ordered Veggie Pad Thai and I was pretty impressed. Stopped for lunch with a few friends and we had a really positive experience. The waitress was nice and attentive, granted it was not really busy so she didnt have much to do, but I would still say that it was more positive than I have had at countless thai places. 

I would def stop in again for a reasonably priced meal.
author: Jennifer S. C.

description:
restroom is for customers only LOL - so i sat down and ate..actually the only REAL restaurant in the Haight and Ashbury district...

I ordered Pineapple fried rice..typical order ..but amazing taste and presentation!! i loved it . Good service and not expensive at all..

I totally recommend this place...i dont live in SF but will come back here when i go back!!
author: Gisselle R.

description:
This is always our first stop in the district before an afternoon of shopping. It' s such a cozy little restaurant with such delicious food.

Try the coconut soup as opposed to TOM YUM especially if you like cilantro.. it's a warm and very flavorful start. This last time I had the butternut squash massuman curry with chicken and it was soooo good. I also recommend their coconut prawns, my sister ordered them, and it too was cooked perfectly. 

The servers here are always quick and very attentive, and the prices are great for the quality of food you get. 

A definite must try if you enjoy Thai.
author: Lynn D.

description:
I found a note to myself to review this place.. problem is... it's been over 4 years since  I've been there (yeah, it's an old note) that I can't remember what I ate. 

Knowing me in 2008, I'd venture to guess that I had the Pad See Ew, and that it's super delish. 

I do, however, remember that I loved this place... so much that I was always trying to get Patricia to go with me. Of course, she always convince me to go somewhere else since there are so many other options in our hood.
author: Charlie L.

description:
Went here for dinner with friends and it was delicious!

Ordered the Pad See Ew, Cucumber salad and a pitcher of beer - hands down the best pad see ew I have had in the city! Just the right amount of chicken and broccoli. 

Will defiantly make another visit!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Definitely the best Thai food on Haight. I would probably give it three and a half stars, but based on its superiority over the nearby competition, four seems appropriate. 

Service is friendly and attentive, almost to a fault. Sitting by the window guarantees some interesting people watching as it's by a somewhat sketchy corner of Haight. Anyways - the food! Probably the best pad see ew I've had in the city. Perfectly flavored, delicious fried tofu. The Thai iced tea is delicious and the prices are all quite reasonable with a good specials menu. Looking forward to trying all of the curries.
author: Courtney A.

description:
The food was just alright, pretty bland actually. I went because Ploy II was closed. 

The service was TERRIBLE. The two waitresses working that night walked past us over and over without seeing if we needed anything. It was not that busy. Everything was slow and they were acting as though we were burdensome.
author: diane b.

description:
Had lunch here before an afternoon of thrift store clothing shopping.

Everything was fine.  I had the pad thai, wife had thicker noodles (pad see ew?), friend had curry.
author: Frederick H.

description: Absolutely DELICIOUS! We were walking through the haight and looking for a place to sit down and eat. Yelp helped us find this gem. WOW! What a surprise! The food was outstanding. We had 6 people in our party. We each ordered something different and everything was amazing. I personally had the coconut soup and the coconut pad Thai and added bok  choy, both were the best I have EVERRR had! Highly recommend!
author: Saria F.

description: Siam is a very quiet little thai place with a friendly wait staff. There isn't a scene at this place just a simple little restaurant. I really liked Siam and would definitely go back if I was in the area. We had the mango and salmon w/ pangang curry and the pad see ew with chicken, both were solid dishes. The folks that serve here are really nice. We had their thai tea, very caffeinated but had a very bold taste. Overall, solid experience.
author: Michael S.

description: Really good Thai food! Haven't had some truly good Thai in a long time, this place is authentic and actually makes it "Thai spicy" when you ask for it so be careful. Had the panang curry and it was delicious. Small place but does the job. Enjoy...
author: Nick B.

description:
We went for the gluten free menu.. .and what we got was the sweetest woman ever to serve us. She was so polite and made some addition suggestions to items that weren't on the menu. You can tell that she was having a great day and that she has some stake in the business. It was absolute pleasure seeing her enjoy herself. 
I don;t get down to the Height that often... but I will come back just for kicks.
author: Kathie R.

description:
Sticky garlic chicken.... 25% chicken, 75% brown rice. Still pretty good.  Don't pair with an IPA. 

This is actually my new favorite place for thai in the city. I even like it better than Lers, because this place is less pretentious and the flavors of their dishes are better. Its like the perfect delivery thai. The perfect, "I am in sweats and its finals and I hate all of you and have thrown personal hygiene out the window" kind of thai.*

*Thats not why I was there.
author: Emily D.

description:
LOVE this place. 
Staff=Awesome 
Food= Awesome (OMG Try the duck salad even if you are on the border of liking duck or like me who used to say, "I only like duck when it is in French food"-Duck salad is NOM NOM. 
Location=It's in the Haight

My Thai friends had been visiting the states for awhile and were missing good Thai food. I brought them here and they were both VERY happy! I guess other places they had been to  just didn't live up! 

I used to go to Ploy II but Siam stole my heart a long time ago. I also used to live around the corner and sometimes will drive back there just because it's that yummy. 

What more can I say to convince you to go? Oh yeah, $2 beer for happy hour that I think ends at 7pm. 

Nuff said
author: Kat M.

description:
When I want the perfect cup of Tom Kha soup, I drive down from Marin county to get it here. I've been doing this for about 9 years, off and on. Wonderfully balanced, not too spicy and not too sweet... it's a little taste of heaven. I've never had to wait, the staff is always kind and courteous and everything I've tried here has been fresh and fabulous.

The Phad Thai is excellent - not sticky, perfectly cooked and the recipe is pretty authentic. The Spicy Eggplant is fabulous - great texture, rich and satifsying. The Pumpkin Curry is wonderful and if you really want to treat yourself, the Mango Salmon Panang Curry is nothing short of remarkable. The only thing that is a little bland is the Thai Iced Tea, but I'm not really complaining. 

Pricing is standard. Ambiance is nice - even though it's a lively restaurant with most of the tables full, you can still have decent conversations over dinner and not have to strain to listen or speak. Overall a great experience, fun for family dinners or visiting with friends. Fresh ingredients, perfectly cooked, gourmet flavors that sing to your palate in a friendly, laid back atmosphere that will have you pleasurably hooked from the start. Don't pass this one by, folks.
author: elizabeth d.

description:
I'm sorry, but there's much better Thai to be had all over the city, and even on Haight Street, and even in the Upper Haight, and even on this very block.

I'll let Alyssa G. tell the story because she's much more succinct than I am--and I'm not trying to be, really!--but I'll second that it's a poor replacement for Ploy II, teenagers who wear too much eye makeup aside.

It feels very well worn.  Everything.  The tables.  The chairs.  The menus.  The menu.  The food is all right.  It's not spectacular.  It's not atrocious.  It's not Ploy II.
author: John S.

description:
Siam Lotus Thai Hot and sour soup balances flavors to produce a pleasant and tangy treat. Vegetables al dante, fresh. Excellent warm up for Holiday shoppers or browsers dodging the coastal crud.
We ordered several appetizers, enjoying them along with the green papaya salad.
The real star of the meal was the Savory Mint Roast Duck. Having cooked numerous duck dishes at home recently, I am well aware of how rich the meat is. Siam Lotus serves this dish up lightly chilled, boasting a blend of freshly chopped herbs, not yet set long enough to bruise, a hint of citrus, minced fresh roots and savory baby greens. The texture of this light and fully flavored course is accented with parched rice, ground peanut and crispy wisps of duck skin. While rich in flavors, this is a light dish. Nice surprise.
I am inspired to treat my next homemade duck to a twist of Thai.

Did I mention the service was fabulous, modest and friendly. The chef came out to answer our questions, allowing us to tell HER how much we enjoyed our meal.
author: SF D.

description: Solid Thai food. The waiters are knowledgeable and friendly when it comes to honestly answering questions or offering suggestions. Food was spot on, perfectly portioned, sufficiently seasoned, and fantastically flavorful. All the noodles in the Pad Thai were perfectly coated in goodness (none of that silly business where the noodles are all clumped together and the seasoning/sauce does not reach each strand, lol). Can't wait to come back and try more of their menu!
author: Tuwie N.

description: The crab rice is amazing! I love how the crab does not overpower the rice and how the jalapeño adds a bit of a kick. I also had the level 2 spicy pad Thai. It was good but not spicy. I'll probably go for a level 4 or 5 next time. The service was great. Can't wait to go back!
author: Gaby P.

description: Ate here last night (Saturday); I think they may have been unusually busy so the hour-long wait from being seated to being served may be abnormal. But there can't be any excuses for that coconut pad thai! It's one of the most disappointing things I've ever eaten at a thai place; just boiled large flat rice noodles and a bland curry sauce (ordered medium spicy) with a handful of bean sprouts. Maybe it would have been less disappointing if it was just labeled curried noodles, but I was expecting something like pad thai. Not stir fried, no peanuts, no egg, hardly any flavor or texture, and I was ravenous after the hour long wait, so it probably tasted worse than I experienced it! My husband ordered mango chicken or something like that and it was much better than the coconut "pad thai", so maybe just don't order what I did.
author: Holly A.

description: Eh - don't eat here. It's not terrible and you won't want to walk right out - but an order of Pork Prik Khing just tasted like fish sauce. It was edible and it wasn't bad - the ingredients were good quality - but it certainly wasn't an interesting or developed flavor. Save your money and time and go across the street to Ploy II - much nicer ambiance, better prices and MUCH better flavor.
author: Emily K.

description:
Had a great dinner last night at Siam Lotus.
The place is simple and casual, cordial waiters and fast service.
Let's get to the best part: the food. I ordered a plate of chef's best noodles with beef, asparagus, peppers, thai basil and some other seasonings..it was a really good choice. If I had to say one thing was wrong is that the asparagus weren't much cooked.. but it's still a 5 star for me.
I'll be going back.
author: Robert M.

description:
Other than the fact that I like Thai food, the reason I entered this place was because they had a restroom and I needed to use one badly. 

I was thus pleasantly surprised when I tasted their Pad Thai. It is seriously one of the BEST pad thais I've had in the US.
author: Melissa A.

description:
I was meeting a friend for dinner and we had originally chosen Ploy II, without checking their hours. Unfortunately, Ploy II is closed on Mondays so it was time for plan B. Siam Lotus is just down the street on the same block, which made it very convenient to find an alternate Thai eatery. 

On this particular night, Siam Lotus got a moderate amount of traffic while we were there. Most of the customers were in and out in about 30-45 minutes, which means service is relatively quick.

I tried the Emerald Curry - green chicken curry with eggplant, green beans, bell pepper over white rice.

The menu is fairly straight forward, authentic Thai cuisine. The serving was appropriate, I was able to finish my whole dish. 

The servers go around giving water refills often, so our glass was never empty. As a plan B, it was a great choice.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Very popular, local Thai off Haight St. Their Pad Thai is a good choice, so is the Garlic Chicken, and Golden Curry. If you're in the neighborhood, it's a great option as a casual fare. The service is good considering how busy this place gets, I've seen lines up to the door. It's a great place to catch up with friends, and I always get their Thai Iced Tea! If you are in the neighborhood, try it.
author: A L.

description:
Authentic Thai food in the Haight! I'm very impressed with the food here. We love every dish we ordered tonight. Some hard-to-find dishes include Khao Soi (egg noodles in curry sauce) and Kanomjeen Namya (rice noodles in fish curry sauce). 

Khao Soi is a Northern Thai dish. It's topped with crispy noodles, making the presentation so grand. Kanomjeen Namya is very unique here. The noodles are topped with a big fillet of salmon. The curries here are seasoned well with herbs that most Thai restaurants tend to ignore. 

We also love Larb Duck, Som Tum with grilled chicken and Tom Ka Gai. There're so many other dishes to try. I finally found a great Thai restaurant in my neighborhood!
author: Saran R.

description: Good Thai food. Definitely more Americanized but still pretty good. Wasn't asked for spice level preference and the staff seems a bit rude. Would still come here again if in the area though.
author: May K.

description:
We were walking along Haight street and came upon Siam Lotus. Since it was
around dinner time, we thought we will give it a try. There was a big group seated on one side and our server told us that he couldn't take any more orders until the big group had been served. We were very hungry, but decided to wait anyway. He brought us our wine and told us it would be 15 minutes. We decided to give him 30. The kitchen was trying very hard to satisfy their customers. Guess what? 15 minutes later, our server took our order and we did get our food quickly! Kudos to the kitchen staff who tried their best to keep their customers happy.

Tried the crab fried rice, panang curry and street-charbroiled pork. All were very good!
For dessert, we tried the fried banana with ice cream. Now, this one wasn't top notch.
I've eaten this for dessert before and I know that the banana used should ideally be very ripe so that it's sweet. The one used here was almost raw and didn't taste very good.

Average cost for a bottle of wine is $20. A bit expensive for not-so-great wine.
Restaurant accepts credit cards.
author: Tina C.

description: Very mediocre food. Ordered the lemon grass chicken which tasted nothing like lemon grass chicken but tasted like chicken satay. Other members of my dining party were equally unimpressed. If you need somewhere to eat, this place won't be bad but you will wish you went somewhere better. It's San Fransisco, there is no room for mediocre--do yourself a favor and eat elsewhere.
author: Kyle S.

description:
This place rocks. Brussel sprout salmon in garlic chili sauce.
Again Yelpers led me to a great place.
If you like Thai you can't go wrong here.
Next trip to the Haight we will go back.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Exceptionally endearing waitresses! Our waitress was so darling. She said she loved working here -- genuinely! That's always a good sign. :)

The food was a little different than Thai food that I'm used to. I ordered the eggplant with chicken. The sauce was kind of thin and there wasn't much of it. It was very delicious, but I just like eating my rice with more sauce on it. 

The veggies looked really fresh and perfectly cooked, not overdone. I really enjoyed the salad dressing. The summer rolls were alright. 

I would give it another try if I'm back in the area.
author: Heidi H.

description:
Officially my new favorite Thai restaurant in the city! 

Came here on a Saturday night, a little before 6, and we were promptly seated. Thankfully beat the dinner rush because once we received our food, a line gradually started forming at the door. Anyways, my boyfriend and I each ordered a bowl of Tom Yum soup with veggies, the pumpkin curry with brown rice, and spinach noodles.

TOM YUM SOUP- super delicious, loaded with a lot of flavors and assorted veggies, which I loved. 

PUMPKIN CURRY- we asked for it to be extra spicy and it had a nice kick. I must admit, pumpkin curry was initially not my first pick for the entree, but I must commend my boyfriend because it was a fantastic pick. This dish also came with a lot of veggies and a decent amount of pumpkin. There was a lot of curry sauce and it wasn't too thick, but not too watery. Just the right consistency, but again like I said, loaded with flavor. 

SPINACH NOODLES- this was my favorite dish by far. I dream of these green noodles! It's hard to pinpoint what was so enticing about them, although slightly oily, the combination of the noodles and portobello mushroom just complement each other so well. Definitely a MUST TRY for this place.

Overall, the food was scrumptious, the portions were more than generous, and the service was pleasant.
author: Ada C.

description:
Excellent food.
Fresh ingredients.
Cheerful service
Delightful owner.
Not to be missed!!!!
Love it and will be back often.
author: Moira l.

description:
I came to Siam Lotus with a few friends after encountering ridiculous waits at the Alembic and Cha Cha Cha on a Friday night.  We were seated right away and I noted that while I had never been to this particular restaurant, I knew beforehand exactly what to expect.  The plain furniture and gold and elephant Thai kitsch decor meant it was the equivalent of every Thai place I ate at in college.  Our dinner was no better and no worse than anticipated.

The four of us went family style and ordered hot Thai basil with pork, beef panang curry, jalapeno chicken, and chicken pad Thai.  Everything was just fine.  In general, the flavors were pronounced and each dish tasted pretty good.  I can't say any of the meat was great quality, but for a quick casual dinner, the food was definitely sufficient.  My favorite of the bunch was the panang curry, which had a nice little bit of heat.  I also like that Siam Lotus offered brown rice.

Service was quick and friendly enough and the restaurant was pretty crowded, if not at full capacity.  I'm sure that better food could have been had, but sometimes you eat at the mediocre Thai place and nobody sheds a tear.
author: Steph C.

description:
This is the best Thai food in the Haight! 

Nat, the owner, is super friendly and cares about the food she serves. Alan and many of her servers are super friendly, too.
author: Andy B.

description: Awesome... everything is so good. My favorite is the crispy Thai Basil  chicken wings!!!!
author: Lisa W.

description:
For those who revel in the comforts and monotony of predictability, Thai restaurants are usually a safe bet, offering menu staples like Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and R/G/Y curries. However, it is evident that the chef's skill and creativity are never on realized through these limiting dishes. Imagine having a free throw contest between Lebron and the sharpshooter on your high school team - both would probably make 7 out of 10 free throws, but Lebron's prowess as an all-NBA player can never be displayed in that contest. In the same way, if confined to the same ingredients, a world-class chef and a college freshman cooking for the first time with only a YouTube instructional recipe at his disposal would produce generally indistinguishable Pad See Ew. Thankfully, Siam Lotus's Chef's Special menu showcases the limitless potential Thai flavors can present.

The Tom Yum Fried Rice's teeming bits of fried garlic and chunks of juicy chicken create a whirlwind of flavors that drive an inexplicable desire to acquire a stock-pot full of fried rice to enjoy for days on end; the Northern Curry Egg Noodle's saturated curry flavor thoroughly permeates the buoyant egg noodles; and the Golden Triangle's crispy outer shell artfully envelopes its creamy mashed potato fillings to make a great starter.  The Iced Coffee is sinus-clearing strong and water cups are never empty.  

Siam Lotus is a must-try for Thai food fanatics!
author: Andrew M.

description:
My coworkers and I headed across the street to this place since Ploy II randomly closed down for 2 weeks. 
tom kha gai: overwhelmingly sweet
golden curry: decent but had no kabocha :( i felt cheated
