pad see ew: solid, a bit greasier than usual
Service left a lot to be desired. It did not seem like a busy night but we waited 45 minutes before our order was taken -.- wtf? And another 45 before the first dish arrived. Waters weren't refilled even after I asked twice. Luckily we did not mind people watching, otherwise we would've left..so many colorful characters on the Haight!
Overall, the highlight of dinner was watching a drugged up man smear ice cream all over himself by the window. Maybe I'll do take-out next time?
author: Jenny Q.

description:
My favorite Thai spot in The City, hands down.  Everything on the menu is delicious and freshly made.  One of my favorite dishes is the Pineapple Kiss Shrimp fried rice, and I never go wrong with one of the many curries on the menu.
Family owned and operated -- the proprietor is a sweet heart and always comes out to chat/ask how the food tastes.  There's quite a few Golden Gate Park inhabitants  that congregate outside and I've seen a couple come in and out of this place, but the staff handles the awkwardness with poise, even going so far as to offer water and a a seat as needed.
author: H H.

description: We've lived in this neighborhood for many years and this place was always someplace that we passed by and I never thought twice about. I overheard somebody talking on a bus one day about how amazing it was. I told my wife about it and we had to stop by. Ever since then we've been regulars. What's most obvious is how much they care about the food and the happiness of their customers. This is clearly a family business.
author: Matthew T.

description: I few days ago I dined at Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine and I ordered golden curry with chicken. I was afraid it would be too spicy so I asked for a sample that I found mild (I'm still building my resistance to spicy food). A few clean plates came to us. When I separated them one had some cooked white rice stuck between them. The curry was good. The size of the portion was neither small not huge. The flavor of the curry was inviting and the white rice was a good match. The chicken was well cooked but the potato was a little undercooked. All in all I liked the food although I did not find it amazing. I give 3 stars because I was not impressed and the plates were dirty.
author: X. Y.

description: Ordered the pad thai with chicken.  It was kinda bland, no peanuts, I had to ask for condiments.  Just ok, nothing special.  I by the way spent a long time in Thailand and love Pad Thai.  They need to work on their recipe.  Service was decent.  Nice ambiance.
author: Dave A.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, eat her regularly and love this place.  Nart is the owner and she can help you navigate around any food allergies or sensitives you have.  She can tell you exactly what is and is not gluten free, what can be made gluten free, what has nuts or fish sauce or soy sauce - she's excellent.  She cares about the taste and quality, using mostly fresh herbs rather than cheaper dried versions.  This gives the food depth and flavour that is uncommon.  

She has Thai women cooks in the kitchen because she wants the person cooking the food to know what it should taste like and not just follow formulas.  The pad thai is unusually good, lamb curry is out of this world (and gluten free!), as are salmon with brussel sprouts and the cat fish.  I cannot say enough good things about the staff, food and consistently good experience I have at this place. 

Ploy 2 may have an edge with their upstairs dining room and assumed trendiness, but their food and service just don't compare with Siam Lotus. 

One tip:  They are closed on Tuesdays because that is the day Nart goes shopping for all the fresh produce from around the bay area.  Makes Wednesdays an excellent day to eat there!
author: Kamaljit B.

description: 4 stars for the delicious pad see ew, tasty duck fried rice and great customer service. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Nels A.

description: Amazing, quaint little thai place.  The food is amazing.  We had the tofu lettuce wrap thing appetizer that was unlike any tofu dish I've ever had.  My gf ordered vegetarian massaman curry that was the massaman curry I'd ever tasted.  She has many food allergies and the woman there knew that soy is gluten as well as where all of their ingredients come from (spoiler alert:  all local).  I ordered the pumpkin curry with pork that was stellar.  We will absolutely be back there.
author: David P.

description: Food was mediocre to poor. I think it may ok if you don't eat much Thai. But if you're a big fan of Thai cuisine like me you may be disappointed. Go to Marnee Thai instead!! It's soooo much better (and prettier inside as well)
author: Grace K.

description:
best thai food..
thai tacos are the best...
def coming back. and again and again......
author: Claudia R.

description: Hands down Best PadThai I ever ate! The butternut squash mussamun curry was different but also very good! If your ever in town definitely check this place out!
author: Jordan G.

description: Good stuff had the chicken pineapple cashew chili with rice. Awesome! Was starving! In the heart of Haight Ashburry! Saw a couple of drug deals go on through the window. Made for interesting dinner conversation!
author: Cecilia V.

description: I walked past this place without even noticing it for years and years until my friend suggested we meet there. Food was delicious! Now I don't have to go to the Sunset or the Richmond for good Thai food, it's right here in my neighborhood!
author: Alison S.

description: High quality food in a very reasonable price - the place is very clean - very tasty - must order the shrimp rolls for starter and the coconut Cary chicken.
author: Ed R.

description: This place is Great!! I am a big fan of Thai Food and I had thought that a restaurant near my home was good but I popped in here one afternoon after spending the day in Hippie Hill and I was Left in awe by the food, The plates have different levels of spiciness, me being the Tough guy I am decided go with a pretty Spicy plate, a few minutes and Man Tears later I was full and Happy. The Staff is very Friendly and made me feel warm and welcomed, the placed is very clean and neat. I definitely suggest to come here if you like Thai Food.
author: Johnny C.

description:
So a friend of mine from Boston came over and wanted to see the neighborhood. We were feeling rather hungry and found this place. 

I ordered the chicken pad thai and a thai iced tea. The pad thai was really good. It looks like they give small portions but that is just because they use plates that are too big. The tea was one of the best I've ever had.
author: John B.

description: Pretty good thai food amoungst the many in this part of Haight. They did not have the fat noodles which we all wanted, but we settled for other dishes and enjoyed ourselves. They took a long time to take our order, though, and I wasn't blown away by anything in particular.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
A colleague and I checked in at Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine. We were the first ones to arrive at the scene. 

Seated by the window, I couldn't help notice the "People Love Us on Yelp!" sticker. I thought to myself that's pretty kewl... 

After I settled down, I went with a rice plate, Thai Basil Beef (Kra-Prow) - sautéed sliced beef with chili, garlic, onions, red bell peppers and fresh basil served with salad and steamed rice. My colleague ordered the Golden Curry (Gang Karee) - Chicken in yellow coconut curry with potatoes, kabocha squash, and onions served with cucumber salad and steamed rice. We both requested extra spicy for our dish. 

As we waited for our food, a nice lady approached us from the counter. She noticed that I was taking pictures. Being this area is a known tourist trap; it's not all that uncommon. 

She asked if it was for remembrance sake or for the Internet. I replied with, "I do this for my Yelp reviews". At this point I assumed either she was the owner or the manager of the place. 

Anyhow, we carried on a little bit of chitchat in regards to food reviews, open table reservations, the economy and such. She pointed out to try their "Winter Beer Special" - all tap beer for two bucks a pint! Though it was tempting I skipped the offer. 

Soon enough the food arrived. The aroma was fantastic! My beef was sautéed perfectly and the basil took hold of my palate, which was nice. Coupled with the chili, onions, bell peppers and the extra heat it was delicious! The salad complimented the heat just right. As for my colleague, I got thumbs up for the Gang Karee. 

Several jalapeños and face wipes later, I was very pleased and satisfied. 

The menu offered a variety of Thai dishes and plenty of seating available. 

Before we headed out, the lady introduced herself as 'Nart' and I introduced myself as well. 

Overall service was outstanding and deserved an additional star! 

I shall return...
author: Gary E.

description:
I've been here twice. The first time, I ordered a fried tofu and vegetables dish, which was fairly priced at around 7 dollars. It came with rice and a salad. The taste was alright and unmemorable at best and slightly bland at worst. Then, my friend and I shared a tom yum soup, which for me was a little on the sweet side and not spicy enough. 

The second time, I ordered the mango basil chicken, which I believe was around 8 dollars. It also came with rice and a salad. There were big chunks of mango, which were delicious, but I felt didn't complement the dish very well. The chicken and basil, however, were flavorful and delicious. 

I'd come back for the reasonable lunch specials if I were in the area but I probably wouldn't make a special trip here. Overall, the food was quite tasty but not outstanding and the service was just mediocre.
author: Joan S.

description:
I've lived in the area for 4 years and have always seen this place, but last night I finally tried it.  I am soooo disappointed that I didn't try it sooner, because it was fantastic!  

What was ordered: 
-Golden Triangle which came with a sweet peanut sauce.  Basically a samosa, but way better than any samosa I've ever had.   

-Spicy Rice Noodle with beef:  When ordering I asked how spicy and the waitress told me mild, so I asked to spice it up.  For hotness 4 out of 5.  She said, "are you sure?!!?" which made me nervous so I changed it to a 3 out of 5.  This was an excellent decision!  It was a great dish, beef was nice and tender, good flavor and spicy, spicy just as I like it.

-My friend ordered the pineapple nuts cashew chicken, without the pineapple.  She loved it and I even got a text today saying, "I want more Thai!  It was the best leftovers ever!"

All in all good service, great food, good dining experience.  One of the more authentic Thai meals I've had in the city.  I will definitely be back!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: second best thai restaurant in the city of SF! First is grand pu bah. I went through a detailed all over city search for best thai restaurant in 2012 and ate the same thing (yellow curry with brown rice, customized with no potato and both mushrooms and tofu (soft) and all kinds of green veggies) this place was the second best but pretty good.. while the famous names like osha thai, lers ros, thai idea was okish.. disappointing were osaka sushi and marnee thai..  which had so many stars everywhere but was too spicy for my taste...
author: Nihit S.

description:
Family-owned and operated. The owner, she reminds me of my mom because she is always out chatting with customers and remembers what they like. My family owned a Thai restaurant for 21 years in the city and closed 3 years ago...so finding a place that reminds me of my parents' cooking is difficult.

I love the kao soy they have on the menu and also the duck salad (larb ped). The salad comes with sticky rice, which reminds me of eating on the streets of Thailand, where that is plentiful. Not many places in SF serve sticky rice, and this place does...and does these two dishes right!

A great casual place to bring friends to if you are craving some Thai food.  =) Oh and the mango with black sticky rice at the end of the last two meals I had there...a must. Can't wait to go back again since my mom is in Thailand. LOL
author: Siri S.

description:
Yumm! Very happily surprised. We tried the pad thai, the wok tossed noodles, a salad and roasted duck with fried rice.
Will go back / order again for sure.
author: Virginie F.

description: Heard and read a lot about Siam Lotus, so I was excited to try it.  Food came out quickly and was tasty. Got the coconut Thai curry with pork, but it came with both pork and tofu. I hate tofu, so that ruined it a bit for me.  Drunken asparagus noodles were pretty good.  Food could use a bit more spice but overall a good experience. Service was good as well.
author: Nina L.

description:
How had we not seen this place before? We're in the neighborhood all the time, eating pizza, thrift store shopping and going to 2 markets on the same street! Well, we finally tried it last night - hooray!

The Food:

My date opted for some coconut pad thai - it was a bit like a yellow curry mixed with pad thai noodles with a little kick (a really little one). He really enjoyed the uniqueness of the dish.

I had the roast duck noodle soup (it's become my test the thai restaurant dish lately). The duck was well roasted - duck is already kind of a generally gummy meat and sometimes cooked to be more gummy - not that I mind, but this was actually little more tender. The soup seemed to have more duck flavor than others I've had that tasted more like duck in chicken soup. The broth was just right thickness between hearty and soupy.

We left room and ordered mango with black sticky rice because they offered it out of season. (Note to self: when you know mango is not in season, do not expect a miracle of ripe sweet mango when it's offered). They used one of those harder sweet+tart mangoes. Still good, but I still prefer this dish with the soft manila mangoes; guess I'll have to wait until it's back in season.

There are other interesting things mentioned on the menu I definitely want to try.

The Service:
Super Friendly staff.

The Parking:
If you ride your bike, parking is definitely easier.

Bummers:
They don't deliver :/

We'll definitely be back
author: Kariz M.

description:
Best Thai I've had in years.
Great service.
$2 dollar pints all winter long.
Best people watching from the front window in the city.
I love green curry.
I love green curry.
I love green curry.
I had the Emerald Curry and I could have sat there in the same spot, eating curry and drinking pints all week long.
author: Sherri K.

description: This place has great veggie options and is reasonably priced.  I also like that you can order just a small cup of soup instead of a monster portion.  I had the veggie tofu salad and Tom Yum.  Both were delicious and well priced.  In addition there was great service.  I would come again.
author: Courtney R.

description: Food came out super fast and was pretty good. I got the crab fried rice and thought it could've used a bit more salt and spices, but otherwise it was good. Service was efficient as well.
author: Rowena L.

description: Great little restaurant. Loved their duck noodle soup and their fried banana and coconut ice cream. My friends loved all their dishes. Definitely highly recommend this place
author: B B.

description: Excellent fresh food. Sweet people too. Be careful about your heat level tolerance though. On a scale of 1-5, 3 was a bit too spicy for us.
author: Danny S.

description:
WEIRD: my friend ordered the pad see ew and when it arrived at the table, an extremely heavy smell hit us hard; it smelled just like.. DOG. Like your neighbor's Golden Retriever or something! But it was the meat that had this smell. SO BIZARRE; she was so flabbergasted and asked them to make her another one and the second came back; it didn't smell half as strong but was still there. 

That was disgusting and bizarre.

But I'll give it one more star because MY food, the duck soup was pretty damn good; like pho!
author: Cara G.

description:
Great little place. We stumbled inside while wondering around Haight one afternoon and were very glad we did. The staff are incredibly friendly and great and the food is fabulous! I love their Tom Kha soup, best I've had. The coconut curry was exceptionally great and I had a spicy rice dish that was cooked just right. The owner was really kind to us and personally asked how everything was and explained a little about the food. Overall, great food, reasonable prices.
We will certainly be back when craving delicious Thai.
author: C K.

description:
Wow, a lot of people are giving 4 and 5 stars. Have they not eaten at other Thai restaurants, am I bring a harsh critic, or did I just order the wrong stuff?

I ordered number 30 and my friend ordered a number 27. They're both noodles. One was phai thai with prawns and the other was just thicker noodles with beef and broccoli. 

The food was really good the first few bites, but after awhile, with the door open, my food got cold and began to loose my interest. The food wasn't great. My friend and I found it a bit oily too. 

Overall, the food was okay. A little pricier than the other places I go to (such as Chabba on Irving). But I guess this is what happens when you go try new places; hit or miss.
author: Jess W.

description:
It's strange that I've walked passed the store front so many times and just never had the urge to want to try it out. Maybe it's the signage or the the windows don't necessary allow you to peek in and see if anyone is even inside.

The decor is simply buddha. No purple paint, no photos or illustrations of the Thai king and queen. Not necessarily designed well, but more on the contemporary side nonetheless.

The menu is extensive and everything on the menu is pretty damn good (curries, noodles, soups). My favorite is the kraw pow crispy chicken. It's on the lunch menu, but usually order it for dinner regardless.
author: sally y.

description:
This was the first time I've been here with my friend to have lunch after a bit of shopping in Haight. There are a couple thai restaurants around this area but we decided to try this place because it seemed to be pack and my friend heard that their food was pretty good, so we thought why not give it a shot. 
The service here is quick because the place is small and they have to work quick since they don't want impatient customers especially since they only have two cooks in the back. So when you eat here don't go crazy because the food might take a bit longer than expected, patience is the virtue. The servers would make sure that you're satisfied with your meal and they would always check your table to make sure your water is refilled and if you need anything else they will be at your service. 
They also have interesting names on their menu all we got was curry. My friend got the emerald curry which was the green curry and I got the scarlet curry which was the red curry. Even though, the meal titles have unique names I think that's what would bring your attention to the items, I thought the food was delicious because of how the spices went well with one another and the meat in the curry was cooked at perfect temperature along with the rice, plus the dish wasn't spicy as some other restaurants. I would most definitely recommend this place to eat whenever you're in Haight.
author: Victoria G.

description:
The atmosphere in here was relaxed when I stopped by for lunch during the weekend. Soft 80's songs were playing and the staff was helpful. There were a variety of lunch specials, I tried the golden curry which I thought was very good. The curry was slightly sweet and not spicy with a good amount of chicken, squash, onion and potatoes in it. Rice, salad and a side of sweet and sour pickled cucumbers were included.

The food and pleasant atmosphere made for a nice lunch.
author: Evelyn T.

description: Good service! Food is good and good price as well. The tonka soup was great!
author: Ibelig V.

description:
To be honest, I was drawn in by the $2 Happy Hour drafts (a great selection including Sierra Nevada, Sam Adams, and Ranger IPA), but the food was tasty and the menu was a bit more extensive than your typical Thai restaurant fare. I had a perfectly sauteed serving of brussel sprouts with salmon that was just the right size for dinner. Dishes are served as either an entree or as a rice plate. If you're sharing several dishes with a group, go with the entree sized portion. 

The service was fast and pleasant, and the waiter was even nice enough to ask whether we wanted additional drinks before happy hour ended.

A great local Thai place. Highly recommended.
author: Erik L.

description: Easily the best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand! Food was tasty, not too oily/greasy, and packed with flavor. Great comfort food served in a friendly setting with great service and very reasonable prices.
author: C F.

description: I must say, this was some damn yummy grub!   I had the pad thai, which I know is super boring.  I never order it, but for some odd reason tonight....I JUST EFFING WANTED BORING PAD THAI.   It was the best Pad Thai I've had.
author: Matt V.

description: Nice server. Avoid the coconut pad thai; it's weird. Probably better to go w the normal pad thai.
author: Eagan H.

description:
When you go to this place you need to just say the following 2 words: mango curry.
End of story.
author: Some D.

description: This place is the bomb.  Beers on tap, not just Thai beer, they have other beers which you never find that in a Thai Restaurant.  And on top of that, the food is soooooo yummy. I'm such a BIG FOOD Critic and this one counts.  A must try.  Definitely coming back. That's right, I said it. Coming back..lol
author: Momma J I.

description: Super, fantastic, yummy Thai food! I consider myself a Thai officianado...... and this is one of the best in the bay!
author: Kristy L.

description:
We eat here all the time, and can never seem to get enough.

The seasonal pumpkin curry is excellent, and their pineapple friend rice is worth coming back for on its own.  

That they have a friendly staff just tops it all off and makes this place easy to recommend.  

If you can't eat gluten, you can ask them to make the Pad Thai gluten free and it is delicious!
author: S M.

description: Everything was great until I found a hair in my dish, the waitress only offered me a 20%discount even though I only had like 3 bites. I told her I shouldn't even be paying for the dish and the waitress gave me a hard time for that. Wow. Unbelievable.
author: Richard M.

description:
Went there yesterday as my wife and I were exploring different neighborhoods in San Francisco.  I eat a lot of Thai food, and have my go to favorites, but this is one of the few restaurants that had lot of atypical menu items that you find in other restaurants. Those items not only sound good, but actually taste good as well.

While it's a small restaurant, the tables aren't crammed together like many other places in SF, and the service was very friendly.
author: Buddha B.

description: I came in yesterday for lunch and decided to pick the sticky garlic rice plate with chicken.  The crunchy garlic on top made this dish so good.  I devoured this cuz it was that good!  I will definitely come back.  Prices are reasonable and staff are nice and attentive.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Really delicious. I had a specially made veggie coconut pad thai, which was delicious and the rest of our big group of out of town guests raved about their entrees. including mango chicken and a catfish dish. The tom kha gai was as tasty a it gets. Also, I noticed several families here with kids, because it's a family friendly spot.
author: Susan L.

description: I was very happy with their pad thai. I got the shrimp pad thai and it was the perfect serving. I would be happy to come here again, but it didn't stand out as a restaurant I will personally go out seeking. I will mostly likely eat here again as the Haight is a common visit for me.
author: Sara H.

description: Excellent food, fast and friendly service. For Thai food lovers, this place had a few things on their menu which were unique. We had the panang curry with salmon and mango and the salmon was prepared perfectly, while the mango was the sweetest and juiciest mango I've ever had (although this could be a seasonal thing so if you come here other parts of the year it may not be as good).
author: Erik H.

description: This place is the bomb. I'm actually pissed it took me so long to figure that out and start ordering from here. Even my picky husband, who is quite new to the awesomeness of various Asian cuisines, loved everything we got, from the pork appetizer to the sweet and sour pork (apparently I was feeling piggy that night). I keep hinting that we need to order from here again. It will happen soon!
author: Lesly S.

description: Freshest most natural thai I've ever had. Highly recommend this place. Had chicken panang curry. Perfect. Friend had salmon mango panang special. He raved.
author: William S.

description:
The food here is great but the lame classical music is really annoying. Go to "We Be Sushi" and take note of the beats.... always playing something dope in there. 

I would most likely get my food to go from Siam Lotus just so I wouldnt have to be tortured by the horrid music..... get it together guys .. you are in the upper Haight ... its a hip neighborhood ... you will catch more flies with dope beats!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Thai Cuisine in the hipster land of Height? Can it be? uhhh me thinks not!

Just a couple of college kids, super TIRED and HUNGRY from walking up the GAZILLION hills of San Francisco, looking for a place to eat, couldn't decide on what to eat and decided to try this place. (wish I had the Yelp app on my phone so I could've checked this place out before going in)

The place is kind of small and cramped. Not too many people inside. The food was hella expensive for what we actually got. The service kinda sucky, and they messed up on our receipts. 

I had some soup while my friends stuck with the original pad thai and some other dishes. Honestly the dishes were on the small size and did not look so hip hop happenin'. weird.... you would think Height offered some super authenic Thai food that hipsters can rave about.

Nope. My suggestion? skip this place and head over to the nearby pizza place... that place looked much more appetizing AND had tons of people in it. Always trust the crowd, they know what they're doing.
author: Aurora P.

description: We had the BEST meal at Siam Lotus. We're from NYC and there are so many (terrible) options for Thai restaurants here. This was such an authentic experience! The owner recommended us a wonderful noodle dish and a curry dish. Both were so flavorful, with no sugar or grease added. Clean plates, natural and fresh ingredients, great vibe! We loved it! And it's cheap...! A MUST!
author: Alexandra J.

description: Somewhat disrespectful service. Quantity for price wasn't good either.  Mango sticky rice was great however.
author: Keith L.

description: This is our local Thai place.  The food is very tasty, and the specials are good.  We mostly carry-out, but the atmosphere inside is fine. simple but friendly.  Doesn't seem to get crowded often.
author: David D.

description:
Siam Lotus is my favorite Thai place in all of San Francisco. It is so good, I come here or get take out once a week. Cheap, comfortable, and delicious. Great location in the Haight, and you can always get a table without any wait. 

Everything I've ordered here has been awesome: the coconut soup, the green papaya salad, all of their curries....especially the Mas-Sa-mun (peanut-based). My best friend is obsessed with their green curry, hence why we return all. the. time.

Their Pad Thai (and veggie Pad Thai) is mouthwatering...it's so hard for me to order something more exciting when I know just how great it is :)

When I do stray from the classic, the Thai basil chicken is a great choice- fresh veggies and flavorful minced chicken.  Really, the only thing I've had here that hasn't been the best I've had in SF is their Pad-See-Ew. (If you're a Pad-See-Ew lover in this 'hood, head to Thai Place on Divis. The only dish they do better than Siam).

Don't forget to save room for the black sticky rice with mango. If you haven't had this Thai dessert yet- get it here. Please. I dream about it sometimes.

Ambiance and service are nothing to write home about, but they work hard here and allow you to sit as long as you want without bugging you. And on a cold SF night in the Haight, this is one of my fave places to eat and relax! Just delicious!!
author: Colette H.

description: Enjoyed this restaurant, this much like any other ethnic food, each has a special way of using the same ingredients and names for dishes but the end result surprisingly different and in a good, beautiful way, The veggie tofu thai salad was amazing and thai tacos filled with chopped chicken spiced with all those Thai herbs and spices wow, all of us enjoyed our meals, from traditional pad Thai to Tom Ka soup, a must return to try other menu dishes... Great job ling, can't wait to get back to San Francisco and visit you all again.
author: HJ C.

description:
Best Thai ever and the service is so friendly.  Love the ladies who work there, they always are smiling and despite my frantic ordering style they always get it right!  The place has such a family atmosphere to it and their beer specials for happy hour are pretty darn good.
My favorite is their Pad Thai with Prawns and I have them add pineapple. The curries are excellent, especially the lamb, and so is the shrimp roll appetizer.
Everything is always as it should be here.  I love that I can count on their thai food!  
The only compaint I would have, which will not lower the star rating, is that they are closed Tuesdays! And it's Tuesday and I want Siam Lotus.
author: J. S.

description: Decent thai, nothing special. Service was a bit slow as well.
author: Emily S.

description: Midday meal, had the mango-basil.  Delicious and unique.  Service was fast and polite.  The Hostess was very pleasant and attentive.  We also tried the deep fried Calimari, but didn't care for it as much.  I don't recommend it only because I've had better at many other places.
author: Sharon E.

description: Tiny place, friendly serivce and great food.
author: Devangb B.

description: Excellent food, friendly service and reasonable prices!  One of the best green curries I've had.
author: April H.

description:
Holy shit!
(Can you curse in a Yelp review? If not, then "Holy sheet!"  Which is basically like saying the exact same thing, but now with an accent.  Somehow, that passes.)
-ahem-

SIAM LOTUS THAI CUISINE:

The food here has the power to change who you are as a human being.  This food is SO GOOD, and SO AUTHENTIC that you WILL BE a different person after eating here.  
A better person. 
A happier person. 
A wiser person.  
You may not walk away from this place all of a sudden now understanding calculus or trigonometry; curing cancer and outsprinting Usain Bolt for the Gold (nice Olympics reference, I know...) -- that's not what I mean by different and better and happier and  wiser. 
What I mean is that the way that Siam Lotus' food connects with your taste buds and methodically proceeds to completely envelope every single, solitary nook and cranny of your entire olfactory pleasure center is so much more than 'enough' to render the old you "old" and the new you "new."
I walked in a tired and poor soul.  Lost and looking for meaning.  Or at least a nice lunch and beer.
I walked out of Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine a rich and energetic soul.  Happy, content, ambitious.  A conqueror of a nice lunch and beer.
Eat here.  You'll see. 
Service was attentive. 
Atmosphere was pleasant. 
Food changed me for the better. 
I will go back. 
Oh yes, I will go back.
author: Carl L.

description:
I can't recall everything we ordered, because my mom did all that, but I know their pad thai was OUT of this WORLD!!!

Everything had the right amount of spiciness and flavor. The wait on a Sunday night wasn't terribly bad, but there was one. We just browsed whatever shops were still open at that time. 

They do have some light cocktails there, which are bit on the pricey side considering the size of them.

I highly recommend ordering the Angel Wings, you won't be disappointed with them.
author: Jackie F.

description: Great food, great service, reasonable prices.  Will eat here again when in SF
author: Nancy H.

description:
Went to haight street to do some shopping with a couple of my friends. The drive there made us hungry so we decided to have thai for lunch. There were several thai places around but we chose this place bcause of the great yelp reviews.

We weren't disappointed. We started out with the shrimp rolls for appetizer. I decided to try their ginger pork dish. Their thai tea was so frefreshing and the dishes we got were really good. We even had room for desert so we ended up getting the mango with black sticky rice.

Even though their service needs a little help, I think they still deserve four stars for the delicious foods!
author: Glenn L.

description:
It was one of those lazy Sunday's where I thought what best would suit my cravings was Mexican food, but when I saw this place, I couldn't go elsewhere.

In my opinion, nothing fancy-schmancy about the decor, etc, etc, but that doesn't matter at all because the atmosphere is so chill and the food was amazing.

For ages I couldn't make up my mind when choosing a menu item.  Finally, I went with one of the two lunch menus and decided upon some dish with Tofu, Rice Noodles Veggies, and Coconut Milk broth.

I think it's called something like Lotus Delight.  Anyways, it was so amazing.  Very fresh yummy veggies, a fabulous portion for lunch, and the tofu was so yummy!  I just wish there was a bit more tofu.  Maybe it's hard to pick the wrong thing on the menus, but I knew I couldn't have gone with something better....
author: Alanna F.

description:
I love when the people in the restaurant are so passionate about their food, they can recommend the best of the best without a doubt in their mind. I have been to many Thai places on the "Authentic Scale," and this is definitely my favorite. The food was so fresh, fast, an deelicious!

1) Hot Thai tea... So good, served without milk (which was awesome because I'm not a big milk person and the cold tea usually has milk in it, so it's optional here). It was refreshing; I had 6-7 cups because they were constantly refilling ;)

2) I ordered Emerald Curry (Gang Kiew) with Tofu. Could have got the tofu curry but I wanted eggplant! Ordered with sticky rice. Nomnomnom... My aunt doesn't even like eggplant, and she kept eating my dish! That's fine with me, because I love to share.. But she is a picky eater and I'm just saying! Soft tofu, spicy (just the right amount), fresh vegetables, and accompanied with sticky rice. Great dish.

3) My Aunt ordered the something Egg Noodle dish (I don't see it on the menu online) and it was phenomenal. Special northern-style dish that was recommended... Home-made noodles with crispy noodles on top. We had it with beef.. And wow! The flavor, the texture and consistency of the noodles, the beef (my aunt said because I don't eat meat) was all amazing! 

3) To top it off, we had the Sticky Coconut Rice & Mango dessert. Now I am not a big dessert person, I usually never order dessert. But the Thai has got it goin' on with this dish, so I order it every time I go out and eat Thai. Ohhhhh the warm, slightly sweet, coconut drizzled rice with a touch of sesame seed, complimented with fresh, chilled mango by the slice... Truly rewarding.

I am definitely going to visit this place every time I visit my aunt in San Francisco. And she plans to get take out from here often. They are green and you can find their menu online !
author: Jacque H.

description: If I could eat a Lotus Bowl from Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine every day of my life I would be so happy.  The lemongrass coconut broth that makes up this soup is to die for.  Always make sure that you ask for peppers to spice up your dish.  The Green Papaya Salad is one of the best I have ever had.  Not only does their food taste fantastic, they present it beautifully on the plate and the service is great.
author: Stacey H.

description:
I've been coming to Siam Lotus about once a month for the past five years and have never been disappointed. There are so many Thai restaurants in the city that serve the exact same dishes. If what you want is predictable and boring Thai food, you should go to one of those purple chain places that serve sad imitation Thai food. Perhaps Siam Lotus is not for you. 

What keeps ME coming back?  

The incredible array of dishes to choose from at this gem of a spot--tons of specials, combinations you've never heard of, as well as the typical Thai standards for those too hungry to order outside their comfort zones.  

Big flavor and fresh ingredients.

Staff/owner are attentive and sweet.

Chef will create the perfect degree of spice for the bravest among us (in my opinion, more than a 2 on a scale of 5 is trouble.)

My go to's:

Coconut Pad Thai
Imperial Noodles 
Pumpkin Curry 
Sticky Rice w/ Mango

Bon appetit!
author: Vicky V.

description:
Siam Lotus has the best Thai Food on Haight hands down.  I'm a huge fan of the Red / Scarlet Curries, but the Green / Emerald Curries are a favorite too.  Phad Thai is solid and generously portioned.  For appetizers, check out the Thai Tacos or Spring rolls.  

Why no 5 stars?  Atmosphere is only OK.  If you want something more impressive, head across the street and up the stairs at Ploy.
author: John H.

description:
I've been here only once. I love thai food and it was good! The service was ok. But I've been to better thai restaurants and more charming ones.
The food was good and it was cheap.
author: Katja J.

description: It's easy to see why this place has won awards. The food was excellent, the prices were fair, the food was hot and the service was friendly. satay, Penang  curry, brown rice. House salad included. Cucumbers salad side. Mango and black rice dessert all excellent!  Don't think twice - only ding is ambiance but who cares it's the Haight. I'll be back.
author: Sea F.

description:
I live in Alameda but my dentist is in the Castro. I'm having a bunch of prophylactic dental work done on Mondays, one of my days off, so it's a great opportunity to do City stuff. I used to live around Buena Vista Park, so I took the opportunity yesterday after the dentist to walk my old neighborhood. BV Park can be so much fun. ;)

After the fun, I decided to walk up Haight. I was in the mood for something ethnic and actually was thinking of Ethiopian (or the closest thing in the Haight, Eritrean.)  Well, Massawa was closed.

Ok, so now to my report. :)

So I found Siam Lotus. I only had 2 dishes, I was by myself, and it was lunch.

I ordered tom yum and larb gai, both spicy. I usually order the chicken in the soup. It wasn't on the menu but the waiter spontaneously asked if I wanted shrimp (on the menu) or chicken. Also he asked me if I wanted sticky rice with the larb. That's how they have it in Thailand. I knew that from a visit to a Thai restaurant in Germany, never having been to Thailand itself. No Thai restaurant in the US had ever suggested this. I was impressed. Both the Tom Yum and the Larb were excellent, some of the best I've had.

And the service remained very good. A couple on bikes came in and one of them was putiing the bikes away. The waiter reminded them to be sure to lock them securely.

I'll definitely be back. I hope other dishes are as good.

Edited to say: I went back with my partner on 07/15/07. We tried some other dishes including the gai kraprow, the thom kha, and the neua yang. They all were excellent!
author: Nobbi L.

description:
I can't praise this place enough.  I see that many have written fine articles and I can't top them.  I have read some disgruntled reviews & I know they were anomalies as I have eaten there for years when I lived in the Haight & liked it better each time.  I have never experienced bad service or food. Their cuisine is only elevated in recent years. Yes, the food will change you. It is more artfully prepared than before, if that is possible. ..just delightful.  Give this place a visit. 

Plus, the owners are lovely, treated a special friend well, treating him with utmost kindness and sincerity in his time of need. That alone, buys my loyalty.  I have moved away from SF now,  but I always go back for a meal there. It's worth the trip. 

Look, you can cadge a good parking space in the neighborhood once in awhile, there is plentiful Kezar parking nearby, it's served directly by 4 MUNI lines & indirectly by 2 others nearby.  You can always catch a cab. GG Park is nearby & Haight Street is good for people watching.  What's not to like about the place ?  Go on, give it a visit.  I don't think you will be disappointed. These people have a lot of heart.
author: Mary M.

description: If one is inclined to seek boundaries, they're a bit blurred at Siam Lotus.  This is a cozy neighborhood spot in the heart of an area which attracts many out-of-towners.  The brown rice and sustainability crowd definitely holds court here, but the food pays credible homage to authentic Thai.  Decor couples Summer of Love with Thai folk; tightly packed tables with counter seats.  There is vast menu coverage of both standard Thai fare and several rarely encountered regional specialties and lots of duck variations.  We personally had no issue, but Clara G's account of twice being served what I'll presume to be putrefied meat is deeply troubling.  What we sampled from the kitchen was tasty.  Service is hard to assess; the dining room was packed, and it was clear that their service team was woefully understaffed.  Yet, small groups of servers congregated in the corners, chatting and joking; presumably awaiting the right karma and/or chia to do some work.  In summary, enjoyable but undeniably Haight-Ashbury-- for good or bad.
author: Steve G.

description:
On a recent trip to SF, just happened to be passing by, looking for a lunch niblet spot.  Saw the Yelp sticker in the window and decided to give it a try.

YUM! Everyone loved their food - shared the Thai Basil Chicken lunch special with my husband - best version of that dish I've ever had.  The salad dressing was delicious.

Friends had the curry chicken and loved it too.

Service was great!
author: Heidi M.

description:
My manfriend & I came here for brunch during our shopping extravaganza on Haight Street. We had just ate breakfast 2 hours before shopping but couldn't resist the specials we saw advertised outside. Just as 85% of the other yelp reviewers claimed, you can't go wrong with $2 pints! 

Initially, we just wanted to grab some brew & an appetizer until we saw a woman with a delicious looking Thai iced tea. We ditched the ideas of beer and went with Thai iced tea, chicken pad thai & a pineapple glazed chicken lunch entree. Yeah, our whole game plan of just beers & eggs rolls turned into a whole meal & thai tea! 

** Don't let the plates fool you! They make the portions looks small but they are actually a good size. I even had leftovers :) **
author: Joan C.

description: The food is super good, and the waiters so kind!!
author: Philippe M.

description:
nommy nommy nommy!!! 

Took a break here while taking my i fl bff around one of my (as well as everyone else in the bay)'s favorite spots! it looks like a hole in the wall place (which more often are than not, are always serendipitous to my belly haha), but what caught our eyes & attn was their  extensive descriptive menu and modest prices!

We are both Thai Cuisine enthusiasts, so I'd like to think we semi-know what we're talking about/looking for haha! 

She ordered a chicken & rice dish (i forgot, perhaps angel wings like she always does ?) and  tom yum soup (to all my filipinos, think spicy, spicy and more sour sinigang, LOL! delicious both A+! 

I on the otherhand, fairly knew to trying spicy foods, wanted to try the Green or Penang Curry ( but I was unfortunately not feelings so daring that day!) I opted rather for my typical chicken pad see ewe! Very scrumptious. They give a generous amount of meat and a lot of broccoli!  (double brownie points!)

and to top off our amazing random pit stop (we weren't even that hungry HAHA)

She had me try her favorite Thai Desert: sweet Mango & Sticky rice!!!!!!!! I am now OBSESSED! so delectable and mouthwatering! The mango was so soft it practically melted in my mouth! It rested on a bed of (so fittingly named sweet sticky rice)... i'm not sure how they prepare it, but our other friend Daniel said it's relatively easy to make! I'm pretty sure there's loads of condensed milk somewhere in the recipe? 


all in all it was a treat for our shopping bellies! The only reason it's not a 5 is because of the overall ambiance! it was kind of small. I was back to back with a fellow patron. No Bueno! 

A- for presentation of food tho :) MUST TRY! IF YOU ARE A THAI FAN AND IN THE HAIGHT & ASHBURY!!
author: kimberly p.

description:
I tried this place for lunch after a craniosacral session with my therapist.  I was starving... so I was about to chow big time.

Well, I got seated and I looked at the menu and found it very interesting that they were very heavy on their tropical fruit use.  I am not sure if that makes them less authentic, but I might have liked that if I was here on a day when I was curious to try new flavors.  But today, I wanted my good old staple Thai dishes.  

I ordered a som tum salad and their spicy eggplant lunch entree (comes with rice and salad) all for myself.  Oh, plus thai iced tea.

Som tum was good, spicy (as usual), making my tongue all sensitive and in pain by the time I moved on to the lunch entree.  You know how when you order the Thai garlic eggplant, they mark it as "spicy" but often times they are not THAT spicy?? Well, their eggplant was one of the spicier ones I've had.  I first thought it was my sensitive tongue but all the pieces of chili pepper in the sauce confirmed it : P  

The portions were big.  I was expecting the lunch entree dish to come with just a little cucumber/lettuce garnish on the side but their "salad" that came on the side was pretty good sized for what these lunch plates tend to be elsewhere.  I just might be willing to skip the som tum and just do the lunch plate next time and still feel nutritionally balanced :)

Can't comment on their dinner menu yet... but so far, not bad!  You probably would find me here a few more times for lunch : )
author: Sascha O.

description:
As a native Thai, this is by far the best Thai food in the city and I don't understand why many people do not know of this mouthwatering restaurant! 

I eat here often and everything is delicious! I haven't found anything that I don't like.  The coconut soup and the northern curry egg noodle (aka. khao soi) are my absolute favorites!! You cannot find khao soi anywhere else and it is a must-have!

I have read the reviews and many people complain about the smell, but if you are not familiar with Thai food, then you should stay away from dishes with fish sauce.
author: Sutinee N.

description:
I thought the staff was great - good service/ friendly and welcoming.
The food was fresh and delicious. We got to people watch sitting at the table in front and 2 guys stopped to read the menu. The one motioned to me if the food was good which I gave an immediate thumbs up. They came in and were happy with their food choices. So I would say if you like Thai or even asian cuisine, you won't be disappointed.
author: Carol T.

description:
In all honesty It didn't really taste thai, like the pepper tasted like pepperoni pizza, something just tasted off in both the spicy eggplant and the House spicy chicken, really not impressed, also, this is random but there was just a rather unpleasant smell coming from somewhere in the restaurant.

Not planning on coming back here.
author: Steven H.

description:
Very tasty! And DOESN'T give me indigestion! Not super greasy like some thai places either.

Their Pad Thai is so tasty, and considering I am pretty much a health nut, I usually go for their veggie dishes. Their veggie curry with Jasmine rice is delicious, and full of carrots, zuccini, mushrooms (yuck, but I just pick them out), string beans, red peppers, basil and my fav tofu (!!) in a green curry sauce.  The veggie spring rolls are great, and come with plum sauce.

You can taste the freshness, and your food comes out steamy hot! The service is quick and thorough, and the waitstaff is very friendly.  Oh, and did I mention the "symbol of excellence" award they have? Yep! 100% restaurant score! A+ in my book!
author: Michelle R.

description:
This is a popular place in the Haight. It's not like there isn't enough competition either. Siam Lotus have managed to stay busy through tough times because they offer decent quality food at economy prices.  
Saturday nights can be tough with out a reservation, but we got in. We kept the meal basic, with Pad Thai and Satay.

This is not the kind of place you really want to line up for. The decor is typical, but not terribly exciting. Outside on the street the usual motley crew gathers, threatening to close in on your "doggy" bag. This corner is always entertaining. -ugh.
author: Roanna Z.

description: Great food and super friendly service!  This has become our go-to Thai restaurant for take-out.  We have ordered several types of dishes- curries, fried rice, noodles, etc and none have disappointed.  The Northern Curry Egg Noodle on the 'favorites' menu is especially tasty.  The first time we ordered from them, they wrote little notes on the boxes on how to construct the dishes.  Such a nice touch.  We have yet to dine-in- unfortunately for the restaurant, the riffraff that congregates outside can be a deterrent.
author: Jen H.

description: lotus is a great spot on haight street to eat.I love the coconut soup,thai tea,and curry chicken ,good food and a great pricee,and there is a cute asin woman who works there who is always smilling. Very WELCOMING!
author: Kristopher M.

description:
Relatively inexpensive, good food with an abundance of lunch specials between 12-4pm. Located right in the belly of the upper Haight. 

Thai basil beef with mango was good - they used HUGE chunks of mango. The mango was a little on the ripe side, so after being cooked up it had a borderline mushy texture, but was still sweet and palatable with the basil and beef. 

Thai iced tea was a delicious sweet tooth fix. 

Green papaya salad was a little heavy on the fish sauce, but I liked it anyway. Because that's how I roll. 

I'm not in that area of SF very often, but I'd hit it again. Service was friendly and attentive, and the price was right.
author: Cara Y.

description:
Came here after a mani/pedi with the girls the other night. We couldn't wait for cha cha cha... too hungry.

This place is your standard thai place. I'm going to say everything is good. I don't mean just the food though. I mean the service, food, price, wait... I mean, everything is good. I don't know how else to say it. It's what you expect from thai food and it doesn't disappoint. 

Was it standout? Probably not. Would I go back if I was in the area? Definitely.
author: Abbey S.

description: Probably the best Thai we have ever eaten.  We shared the chicken pad see ew and the crab fried rice.  Service was quick and amazing, prices are great for what nice portions you get.  Wonderful place!
author: Becky J.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. Friendly service and tasty eats. My go-to here is the snow pea chicken. Especially at lunch when it's served with a simple salad with the creamiest dressing that mixes so delectably with the soy sauciness of the stir fry. It's not on the dinner menu, but I order it anyways... The tom yum fried rice is also especially delicious. 

The nearby Haight sketchiness leaves a little to be desired, and the interior decor isn't outstanding. But definitely some great Thai entrees with good service. Take-out is also quick and convenient. Yum!
author: Melinda H.

description:
This place is great!  If you like spicy Thai food, this is the place. I come here every once in a while since I work close by and always have a delicious meal. I am writing this review for the amazing staff and service. The kitchen has, I think, 2 cooks so sometimes you have to wait a little, but I really appreciate that they tell you this upfront and it is worth it. I came a couple of months ago because we needed to cater a small gathering at my work, 15 people. We showed up maybe 3 hours before we needed the food and the staff sat with us and helped us make a selection. We asked for one small modification and they let us know they didn't usually do that modification but they did it for us because we worked in the neighborhood and they have a strong sense of business community in the Haight. But please don't ask for modifications after reading this review, it was a one time deal! We returned for the food at the specified time and it was packed and ready to go. 
There are a lot of Thai restaurants in the Haight, but this is by far the best one for food, efficiency and service!
author: erika e.

description:
I have a weakness for fruit used in savory dishes and Siam Lotus had so many "specials" offering just that. We had the jumbo prawns with peach curry and it was delicious!

Pluses:
- $2 pints
- brown rice ($2)
- vegetable coconut soup was delicious and well-portioned for two
- Thai tacos; wow, the shell was so kick-ass but the whole thing itself was pretty awesome!!!

I think the only thing keeping this place from being a 5-star rating is the ambiance, or lack thereof. But that's also a part of its charm in a way.

Regardless, I totally recommend this place. Go! Eat! Drink! Enjoy yourselves!!! :-D
author: Chung N.

description: The best Thai food in the city...a gem off Haight and Cole...ordered Tom yum fried rice, pumpkin curry, some salmon mango dish, and fried catfish.  The food is not fully traditional Thai...more like Thai food infused with the diverse cultures that San Francisco melting pot has to offer...service was great...total ace in the hole since we were craving thai food and never been there...definitely going back to this delectable and quaint little place...just be prepared to circle the block a few times to find parking as you know that area has crazy as it's parking status...but the food is total worth it!!!
author: Kevin T.

description: I'm going to give them a low 4 for now... The panang curry was really good, though the beef was a little bit tougher than I like. Also tried the northern curry noodle which was really different from other thai flavors I'm used to; interesting, but not really my thing.  I plan to go back and find out if the other dishes are as good as the panang and maybe see if their beef was just having an off night.
author: Ely L.

description: This place has the most amazing coconut pad thai ever! Before I discovered it, I also tried the panang curry and the tom kha gai soup, both of which were also very good. I usually go around lunch time and there is always space available. The staff is very nice and the food always comes out quickly. They never seem to mind if I sit there for a while after I am finished to do some studying and they always continue to fill my hot tea. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking for some great food!
author: Megan T.

description: Bummed. Got the pad see ew and it was totally and completely flavorless. No idea what distinguished it as Thai food as I couldn't detect any spices. Drenched and dripping with oil despite asking for less oil. Just a couple slices of veggies. Disappointing. (really nice staff though so they get the stars!)
author: Emily B.

description: Decently adequate Thai food.  Not a destination.  I would avoid the Pad See Ew.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Came here after B2B 2009 with a team of Yelpers because our one runner needed some hard core carbs and we're always up for some thai food and were very happy overall. 

Service was fast when we were finally seated. Presentation of the dishes was appealing. Food came out promptly after ordering. 

Dishes I tried included:
- Green papaya salad- Very refreshing especially after the hot day
- Spicy rice stick noodles with chicken- my fave dish of the afternoon especially when you as for some pickled chillies on the side. YUM!
- Scarlet Red Curry- Eeh had better, probably wouldn't order again

Dishes for the lunch menu were all under $10 so very reasonable, thai tea was $2.50. 

Only negative was it was hard to get a waitresses attention sometime but when we did they were very helpful. 

Overall today's lunch experience consisted of good food and good company so I was happy. A 3.5 star restaurant for me but I'll round it up.
author: Nadia L.

description: The food was absolutely great and the staff so nice. Best place to get some food near golden gate park.
author: Martin H.

description:
Two words. Thai. Tacos. 

The rest of the food is standard thai - good, but not blow your socks off. But the thai taco appetizers are worth coming back for again and again...I crave them. This is also a great place to go quickly- service is usually fast, although a bit clueless, but overall I heart this place.
author: Lauren F.

description: Delicious and tasty! I highly recommend the sticky garlic and the drunken noodles.
author: John P.

description: I must have come here on an off day. But I ordered the chicken green curry and thought it was mediocre. Second the service was slow and not so friendly. My friend ordered an eggplant and tofu dish with rice and seemed to like his. I didn't think this place was anything great that made me wanna come back.
author: Natasha S.

description: Pretty good place. Got the pad see ew, calamari, and satay chicken. Small-medium size servings. Not so bad, but not the place to go if you have the munchies. I'd visit again though. I really liked the pad see ew.
author: Athina L.

description:
I enjoy this place because the food is pretty damn good and affordable.  If you go there you should try:
 the golden triangles, chicken pineapple friend rice (I'm a vegetarian but our meat eating friends like it), veggie coconut soup, and if you like spicy the green papaya salad.  their food tasted fresh and not too greasy.  Also, the thai iced teas are very good!

Bottom line is, its not fine dining but if you are in the mood for some pretty decent, well priced thai food that won't make you feel sick afterwards then give it a try.
author: Molly M.

description:
Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine was a 45 minute bus ride but after reading many reviews, I decided it was worth the trip from all the others I'd tried.  Located on Haight Street, it is a great family owned gem in a diverse neighborhood.  Be aware that there are only two people preparing all the meals, which they warn about in the menu so if there's a line, it could be a wait.  When we arrived at 19:30 on a Wednesday evening and there were a few families dining and no line!  Sweet!  After having been walking all day, we quickly decided on a Calamari appetizer, the Mango Salmon Panang Curry and the Brussel Salmon with brown rice.   I'm a big Calamari fan and these were perfectly done - not over cooked or battered.    When the Mango Salmon Panang arrived, my jaw nearly dropped as the dish looked awesome.   I of course got the Salmon with brussel sprouts, something I had never seen done before now.   The sprouts were fresh and cooked perfectly - just crunchy and not mushy.   These blended nicely with the delicate salmon which fell apart easily.   My partner said the Mango Salmon was delicious with the mango being just perfectly aged.    When we asked the about which mango was used, the cook explained that it was a special sweet mango she used for the dish.    

Overall, the service was spot-on and it was a nice touch for the chief to come out and talk to the patrons - especially since they were not brazenly busy.   If you are a big Thai food fan, then Siam Lotus Thai Cuisine is about as non-pretentious and down-to-earth as one is going to find serving exceptional Thai food at reasonable prices.   For me, easily worth the ride and next time I'll allow more time to wander around the Haight area after dinner. Cheers.
author: G M.

description: Hot delicious pad kae mao. Really friendly staff. I had to wait for the bus after getting it to go and they went out to suggest for me to wait inside. Pad Kae Mao was delicious
author: Lin Z.

description:
This is probably my favorite Thai place in the City.  Granted, I haven't been to all of them -- but quite a few and this one always hits the spot.  

Their plating is lovely, the restaurant is nice and big, and the food is delicious.  I can't say I enjoy sitting at the window seats with the odd stares and glances from the seedy characters out on Haight -- but if you sit toward the back the place is quite cozy.

I love that they have brown rice -- their curry is delicious.  I usually get the tom yum soup and a side of brown rice.  Definitely try the mango with the sticky black rice -- oooooooooh soooooooo good!

Also the tom yum fried rice is delicious -- I love tom yum anything!
author: Ashley S.

description: Family friendly. Fantastic food. Fair prices. Loved it.
author: Frederic A.

description: I had the yellow curry. Delicious. If your on Haight and want curry then this is the place. Wonderful do check it out. Service was very nice and friendly.
author: Tim S.

description: Loved this place!! Just went there yesterday for the first time and got thai basil chicken and a curry dish. So gooddddd and the service is wonderful, very nice and more than hospitable!! They say everything is handmade down to their red chili paste they bring out on request. Loveddd it and will be back :)
author: Lindsey L.

description: This is one of our neighborhood regulars. We go here at least once a month for our Friday night date nights. The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is calm and comfortable. The food is great, they have plenty of vegetarian options for those of us who need it. I absolutely love the thai curries. We've never had a bad meal here.
author: Rochelle G.

description:
DIsclaimer: I just moved to San Francisco from Michigan, so my exposure to other SF Thai restaurants is limited--at best. 

With that said, Siam Lotus is the place in the Haight to go to if you want to try really amazing Thai food in a chill atmosphere.  

The first time that I went there, I was just in the mood for something quick and easy to eat on the run.   That is when I first fell in love with the Fried Shrimp Rolls w/ dipping sauce.  My order took less than 10 minutes to come up, but was anything but fast food.   Crispy exterior, perfectly cooked shrimp inside.  You can't go wrong with this app.

The same day that I tried the Shrimp Rolls, I returned to Siam Lotus for my actual dinner.  Yep, I was hooked.  My guest had the Southern Thai Tamarind Pumpkin and I had Grilled Salmon w/ Pear chilli sauce.  The server actually asked us how hot we wanted our food!   We were offered a scale 1-5 to choose from.   Great food!  Loved the heat.

The most recent time that I went there, I got the Fried Shrimp Rolls, Angel Wings, and  Mahi Mahi w/ Spicy Tamarind Sauce (I split this with someone else).  I would recommend the mahi entree along with the fried shrimp rolls to new comers ($20.90 plus tax and tip).   The angel wings were a bit greasy for me.  

I found the prices to be fair.  I found the quality of service to be exceptional.  Our server was very patient, spending lots of time offering suggestions and describing the cuisine.  I kinda loved her.  

Check it out!
author: Floyd R.

description:
Nice decor, decent food, romance in the City.  

On a Sunday afternoon the place was quiet and half full.  The warm, dark interior was decorated with traditional wooden sculpture.  There were five menus to read.  "We have too many menus," conceded the waitress, but I don't really think so.  When you walk into a library, you don't expect to read every book, do you?  

Two of the menus were for lunch specials, good 12pm - 4pm.  We both found something we would like almost immediately.  

We started with satay chicken, and the peanut-coconut sauce had a perfect balance.  Neither flavor overwhelmed the other.  Hey, you want to share food equitably?  Feed your lover, and let her feed you.  Forget about all the emos who want you to get a room.  You'll make sure you each get a fair share of the appetizer.  

Then she had coconut jumbo prawn tempura.  They came with a sweet sweet-and-sour sauce, which was a little richer than we normally find in Thai restaurants.  Again, there was enough meat on  the stick for both of us to play.  

I had Thai basil crab meat with garlic and peppers.  Once more, the flavors did not overwhelm, and the heat wasn't higher than the passion in our hearts.  The white steamed rice on the plate also assured that our palates would not be overwhelmed.  

She drank tea; I drank Thai iced tea.  The whole feast for two was only $25 + tip.  

We appreciated the waitress' helpful and attentive service.  

I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants to challenge me to a fire eating contest, but for an average American it is the perfect place to enjoy the spices of Thailand without the pain.
author: David D.

description:
Just do it.

Brown rice.

It's so much better for you, people! It doesn't taste any different. Really. Come on -- you know it's true...

I really feel I have to advocate what's good for you. Seeing as I'm the picture of health. I mean, I eat super healthy. I eat less than 10 grams of saturated fat a day. All fruits and vegetables and good proteins. No meat, no dairy. I even know how to order Thai food healthy. 

Go to Siam Lotus. Get the spicy veggie rice noodles with tofu. Or any of the steamed tofu or veggie rice plates with brown rice -- they have it here! They have LOTS of healthy options here, and they're ALL delicious. 

Listen to me! Seriously. I'm the PICTURE OF HEALTH. 

Um -- except ignore the last ten reviews I wrote, which were all about my drunken exploits. Because I'm a bonafide dive bar lush who doesn't know when to quit. 

But I EAT HEALTHY, and Siam Lotus rocks for delicious, healthy Thai food. 

And in general, skip the Thai iced tea. Not so good for ya, even if it is yummy. Unless you're a super good-looking, funny, charming dude and I'm really into you, and you're buying. (Who I did NOT meet via PM on yelp, BTW...)

Then you can have WHATEVER YOU WANT.
author: Lisa T.

description:
You know, it's one thing when you visit the neighborhood to shop or take your visiting friends or family around and you can deal with a mediocre meal at Askew or Squat and Gobble or something, it's quite another when you are on the street all the time and have to feed yourself. Sometimes I'll mentally go down the list of places to eat on the street and it'll make me want to rip my eyeballs out in desperation. I like every meal to be a delightful sensory experience or you know, at the very least, taste like something and the overpriced messes they can get away with serving here in this area rarely ever cut it. 

And so, I order a lot of delivery. Or eat Thai food. The only take out that I usually get is either Best of Thai or Ploy. But, even those two were boring me. Then I remembered Siam Lotus. Ignored, sandwiched between the cheapie fashion store on the corner and the hippie store, I never really thought about it before, but I figured I could at least try it. How bad could it possibly be? Answer: Not bad at all! Siam serves up really wonderful pad thai and fried appetizers - I loved the Thai take on samosas, the "golden triangle"  and the pad thai was really great, with lots of tofu and cilantro and none of that stickly sweet taste that BOT usually has.  I have found my new Thai take out haven. I am so happy.
author: Maria D.

description: Meh, just not that good. Stopped in here with the BF one night. Got the roti with golden curry and the eastern Thai veggie. The roti was a lot heavier and greasier than I've had at other places, the curry seemed too runny. The fried tofu on the Thai veggies was way too dry - perhaps it was fried, frozen, and fried again. But, nothing was awful - my boyfriend said his meat dishes were good. I won't be returning, though.
author: Brooke T.

description:
Best thai I have had in SF.

The veggies are fresh.  The flavor is fab.  The tofu is done well.  The people that work there are extremely friendly.  This is the one thai place that I actually will consume my meal in.  Most of the time I have to get it to go and fix it up at home to fulfill my thai cravings. 

Note: this place actually makes their food spicy. I LOVE hot food but ordering it hot there, almost makes my heart stop. 

downfall- again with the no delivery.
author: Kiera H.

description: This place serves up very delicious eats.  However, you can not be in a hurry if you choose to dine here.  The disclaimer on the menu even states "please be patient, we only have 2 cooks for the entire restaurant", so consider yourself warned.  The food is really good and the prices are good.  The bill for my family of 4 was less than $45 dollars.  The service is not over-the-top excellent, but they are definitely kind and worth at least a 15% tip.  I'm not giving it % Star because the restaurant is very cold.  It's a small place which is not a big deal, but the  front door serves as a wind tunnel for the restaurant.  It would be a good idea for them to put a divider at the front door as to shelter the diners from the wind.  We asked that we be moved to another table but we were still good and I heard someone at the next table mention that she was freezing also.  Oh yeah, great side note: They have daily happy hour from 4:00? to 7pm, $2.00 draft beer.
author: Larrisa P.

description:
Thai Taco!  It's a crispy, curvy crepe filled with shrimp, chicken, peanuts and sprouts. It comes with a bowl of marinated onions and cucumbers and it is scrumptious!  Believe the hype.

The Crispy Chicken and Pineapple Fried Rice threw me for a loop, because I assumed it was a single item.  Turns out cc AND pfr were a charming duet of chicken katsu-style and fried rice full of pineapple, cashews, raisins, eggs and aromatics.  The other dishes we ordered were delectable as well and with the food, I could find no flaw.  

The service was warm, however not superior.  Entrees came to us within a few minutes of apps and the water didn't arrive until our third request.

Minor issues, far outweighed by the quality of the food, but I had to justify the lack of a fifth star, because when you take your first bite of Thai Taco, you will think I shortchanged Siam Lotus.
author: Quinn S.

description: Love this place. Authentic bold flavors, super friendly staff, quick and inexpensive. A little to bright but I'm picky when it comes to atmosphere.
author: Brian A.

description:
Food: Not bad. I tried the chicken pad sew yew for lunch and my boyfriend tried the golden chicken curry. He thought his was pretty good and my entree was simple and tasty. They had a nice selection on their menu. I would return here for Thai if I was in the area.

Price: Pretty cheap, lunch entrees are $7.95 and up. Good portion for price.

Atmosphere: It was empty when we came in here today for lunch around noon but this place has nice decor with a relaxing vibe (sometimes you need a place like this after roaming around Haight street for awhile!)

Location: Located on Haight, parking available at meters or side streets.

Service: Pretty good, since we were the only customers dining in the restaurant there didn't seem to be an issue with service. Food came out quick and our water glasses were refilled frequently.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Dude. Seriously. What's with the whole 'modest-thai-restaurant' cover?! Siam Lotus is the Batman of Thai food in the Haight.

The Batman of Thai food? Yeah, I don't know either...just hear me out.

We had pineapple chicken fried rice, jumbo prawns with peaches, & salmon with some other kind of exotic fruit (it is now Friday & this was dinner on Wednesday...I just can't be expected to remember what I ate more than one day ago). Everything was completely delicious, & the prices were super affordable. 

The service was choice, too.

I haven't had any other Thai food in the Upper Haight, & after eating at Siam Lotus, I really don't think I can be counted on to go elsewhere.
author: Pete J.

description:
Mango, Mango, Mango, Mango.

Once upon a time in 2006 we were here for a friend's bday and the waiter ran down the list of desserts and every other word out of his mouth was mango.

Ever since, we've called this place the "Mango, Mango, Mango, Mango".

My butcher, who also moonlights as my boyfriend, and I came here one random Friday night, deciding we couldn't justly spend the birthday money my mother sent me on strippers and blow.

The calamari was decent.  My standard order of Pad See Ew with Pork was decent.  The boyfriend's lemongrass chicken with spinach noodles was pretty good.

All around, a solid thai experience, but nothing really to write home about.  I added a star for the prompt and friendly service.

Completely stuffed, we wandered home where I quickly passed out on the couch watching "Cops"  in a food coma.

Yeah.  Cops.  I couldn't even change the channel the food coma hit so quickly.
author: Jen I.

description:
I was a great experience my first and second time there.

Service: They are quick, nice, and courteous. On a crowded night or not, they definitely are on point with making their guests feel taken care of.

Food: Tasty and well presented. The price is about average for Thai places in SF.

Overall, its a good find in SF, the city of countless Thai restaurants. lol.

enjoy.
author: Rhommel C.

description: Delicious Thai food, and I love that it is right on Haight St. They have plenty of vegetarian options on the menu. The calamari is delicious, as are the soups and all the noodle dishes.
author: Erin H.

description:
My pal from LA ***MADE*** me go here yesterday. I mean, he didn't have to try very hard, but he did goad me into driving to the Haight. He claimed to have good parking Karma, and lo and behold, after only a few minutes, we got a great spot. (Ok, granted it was 4PM on saturday afternoon...)

Anyway, we got in and my pal told me how they have something GREAT on the lunch special menu. But then we noticed the specials ended at 4PM.  So I scoured the menu and found something else. But when they came to take our order, we found out you could still get the item, at dinner priced. So we both ordered the coconut noodle special.  It was really good. The Thai iced tea was good too. And the service was good. 

So why 4 stars? Good question, and I can't quite put my finger on why it's not perfect.  Maybe it's because I didn't try a standard dish, so it's hard to compare it. I guess next time I'll try pad thai or yellow curry.
author: neil c.

description:
Whenever I walk through Haight Street while shopping this restaurant always caught my eye. I love Thai food and I never been to a Thai place where I didn't like the food. Thai never fails me... that is until I came here! I don't know if it's just the particular dish I had, but my sister's fiance who always orders duck fried rice at every Thai place he goes to said this one was not good either. He actually said this was the worst.

I was so sad because I even saw a yelp sticker on their door! Bah.. :( 
The positive.. my cousin's food was actually good, she got the seafood noodle soup. Maybe I shouldn't be so quick to judge since they had a yelp sticker.. but I can't help it. I didn't like haha.
author: Annissa H.

description:
Despite the comments of the other reviewers, I have to pump these guys up.  While I certainly wouldn't go to Siam Lotus to look for an example of world-class service, the food is tremendous - some of the best Thai in San Francisco, it's affordable, and actually quite creative.  I love many of SF's Thai restaurants, but this has become the regular hangout for me.

Don't worry about the service, unless you're in a huge rush and need extraordinary pampering.  If you go, don't miss the Thai Tacos or the Black Sticky Rice with Mango...yum!
author: Josh M.

description:
July 15th, 2006 Update:

Not sure what happened to this place.   But it seems of lesser quality then I remember.  I've been back a second time and ordered this chicken dish that just tasted weird.  The server pretended there was a language barrier when I tried to bring it up to him, even though he spoke english perfectly fine before then.  Not sure I'll go back here that much.  Maybe once a month?

I was introduced to this place about a year and half ago when I had just moved to San Francisco...and I've been looking for it again ever since.  I was drunk at the time and couldn't remember anything about its location except that it was in the Haight....  I got to go again this past week and the chicken fried rice was all I remembered and more although last time I think I had ordered the pineapple and chicken fried rice with raisins and some more stuff.  They seem to have renovated the entire place because it looks totally different, but the plate presentation is still the same.  Good, cheap, dependendable source for thai style fried rice in the neigborhood.  I really haven't tried anything else here...
author: LaSha G.

description:
Siam Lotus is absolutely phenomenal. It's the first place my then boyfriend took me to on a date in Sf when we first met, and it'll be the last place we go to with our families on the night before we say "I do".

A simple and romantic little place with yummy eats. Cheers to Siam Lotus.
author: Alison L.

description:
Thai tacos!
 Crispy, thin rice "tortilla" topped with shrimp, chicken, mysterious sweet thai sauce, shredded coconut, peanuts, lime, avocado (I may have made that last ingredient up, I can't remember). Anyways, chamazing!

We also ordered a special shrimp dish that was really spicy. The waitress kept asking us if we were suuuure we wanted it (because we are total gringos presumably) and we kept saying YES! Bring us the spicy shrimp!

When she brought it out, the entire kitchen staff watched on as we tried a bite. It was in my top 2 spiciest foods, but also had wonderful flavor and we finished the whole dish. 

Minus one star because every time I come here, the waitresses are horrible with the water refills.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I like this place mainly because it's located on Haight Street. I love shopping on Haight street just because it has a very "Bay Area" feel to it. Everytime I go up north I always shop on Haight..

This Thai spot is a small spot with great food! I would suggest to get the Pad Thai and Basil Chicken. Don't forget Thai Iced Tea!! DELISH! : P
author: Oh So Fresh B.

description: I work next door so this has become a pretty regular place for some take out lunch. Most of the noodle dishes are just good, nothing too exceptional.
